case.state: Sorry if I'm a bit late - comin' down a chimney's a pretty new experience.
How are your holidays goin', everyone? Up for makin' them even more happy?
Well then... don't worry, ladies; I'll try not to stare too much.
More guys than I was expecting... guess that'll add to the risk.
So, this is where it's happenin'? Been a while since I had a good card game...
They serve Scotty Bolger's here? Thinkin' I might need it.
...Matrix? Unless you're talkin' about a defense matrix, I think you might be mistaken, hun'.
I'll put away that bag o' goodies for later. Whaddya say we put a little merriment in this game, kick-ass style?
We got any eggnog on hand? Make sure Corporal Turnbull doesn't spike it again.
Tell you what - play real nice, and I'll make sure you get a lovely little gift from that bag.
Hope you're all feelin' festive tonight - it's time we kicked our holiday cheer into overdrive!
All right... time to kick this game into overdrive!
Heh, unlucky for y'all... m'dad taught me poker back in my farmboy days.
Played this plenty of times before... 'course, never done the strip variety.
Heard this joint's the most swingin' kinda place outside the Koprulu sector. I'm ready to see if it lives up.
I'll stick by my guns... though ~cards~ different couldn't hurt.
Take ~cards~ down, pass it 'round.
Alright, pretty good... ~cards~ could be better, though.
Two for two.
Three - one for each finger Sgt. Bronson still has.
Oof. I'll take four new ones.
Gotta play smart... four.
Yeah, this could be better. I'll change four 'a these.
These four gotta go.
No good... take the lot.
Alright, maybe a new hand'll be kinder.
Change of strategy... and cards.
Hell, just about anything would be better.
I'm takin' a second chance.
Just an odd ~cards.ifPlural(few|one)~ out... still good. For the most part.
~cards~'ll do fine, thanks.
Dealer, gimmie ~cards~ here.
Yeah, I'll be needin' ~cards~.
Mind passin' ~cards~ over?
Swappin' ~cards~.
Hm... ~cards~.
Odds could be better... gimme ~cards~.
Changin' ~cards~.
You got ~cards~ for me, dealer?
~cards~ seems good.
Well, this one... I guess I'll take ~cards~.
Exchangin' for ~cards~.
Go ahead, dealer.
Actually... I think I'm good here.
Never one for risks, but... I'll keep it.
Hope I'm not makin' a mistake here...
And the game rolls on...
Finally, some cards I can put my faith in.
Heh, knew my luck would turn around eventually. Well... hoped, anyway.
Looks like I ain't long gone after all!
I never stay down for long.
Just the pick-me-up I was hopin' for!
Talk about good timing!
Don't wanna be rude, but... you're done for.
Well... get ready to chalk up another for ol' Jimmy.
Heh... I don't think this game's big enough for the two of us no more, pal.
Well, ain't that pretty.
Oh yeahhhh...
It's in the bag!
Looks like Lady Luck finally found me again.
Heh, you shouldn't have, dealer.
Hope y'all are ready for this.
Now there's a good hand if I ever saw one.
I don't say this often, but I've got a good feeling about this.
Alright, this should be good.
I'd say this counts for a lot.
Bullets, cards... either way, I'm right 'n loaded!
Now here's some cards I can get behind.
I can dig these.
Time to ante up... so to speak.
Feel like goin' all in?
Sure wish I had these last week at the Hyperion's bar...
Heh, Tychus would be droolin' if he saw these...
Haven't seen numbers this pretty since Bull Company's kill count at Char.
Two words you can put in your pipe and smoke: kick ass!
I think I can count on these.
Alright, who's ready for some pepper?
Time to take some names again!
Heh, always fought the hardest when my back's against the wall.
Ready for this?
...Groovy.
Quite the pretty hand right here...
Hell, I've had worse odds.
Wouldn't be the riskiest gamble I've taken.
Fine by me.
Hey, better than nothin'.
Alright, I can make it with this.
Ready whenever the rest of y'all are.
Hm, not exactly an interestin' round so far...
Yeah, I can deal with this.
Wouldn't kill for 'em, but they're fine cards.
Grease the wheels a bit more, and it'd be fine.
Alright. Just alright.
Hmm...
Hey, even a rusty Vulture can save the day in the right situation.
Yeah, I'll take this.
Well, it could've gone worse.
Not sure how this'll go...
Never was good at bluffing...
Well, if it works, it works.
No one look over my shoulder, now.
All right... just don't hose me over, now.
Well, I'm not out just yet...
Got my trust in these cards... just hope it ain't misplaced.
Hm... gotta start plannin' better.
Can't lie, startin' to feel the heat now.
Wonder if the second idea I had was better...?
Pressure's sure on right now...
Frankly, I could predict the weather on Bhekar Ro better than I could figure where this'll go.
Yeah, sure.
If you're usin' your godly magic to screw me over, ~deitytarget~... well, I'll be real disappointed in you.
Well, it's what I drew. Just gotta deal with it.
'Least no credits are on the line.
Not likin' the look of this...
Alright, not the best hand...
Hm, not exactly the best confidence-booster.
Didn't expect to lose my unlucky streak anyway.
Startin' to hit me how long ago my last game was...
Guess I got plenty of wiggle room, at least.
Still the early game. I've fought back plenty 'a Zergling rushes before.
Man, it's times like this I'm glad I don't have that whole Protoss "Khala" thing goin' on in my head...
If you're tryin' to cheat me, dealer, you should know I used to be a Marshal.
Another thing to add to my list of regrets...
Never was a lucky man...
Game's far from over, fortunately.
Not sure I like what's goin' on here...
Damn... caught right in the middle again.
Probably gonna be time to face the music soon.
Well, not the worst thing in the world... but then again, I've seen a lot of worse things.
Not countin' on this to save me here.
...Well, the rest of y'all have my vote of confidence.
Hm... guess that wasn't the right move after all.
Maybe I should've asked Matt for advice...
This feels like seein' all my SCVs are blasted apart. 'Cept I can't blast anything back.
This is remindin' me of one of me and Tychus' old heists... one of the bad ones.
Yeah, this is goin' bust...
Not exactly the hand I was hopin' for...
Quite the dicy situation here...
...Did I do somethin' rude, dealer?
Got a feelin' my game's about to take some terrible, terrible damage.
Alright... all that's at stake is my dignity...
Quite the time for a misstep.
Man, these cards just don't like me right now...
Hm... what's the card version of buyer's remorse?
Hmph. Sounds like this "coward" was brave enough to stand up to you, at least.
Hmph. I can tell already your brother was braver than you give him credit for.

condition.saying: Gosh, Natsuki. I'm just flirting. Don't make this weird... Jim doesn't mind, does he?

case.state: Wait... she ain't bein' serious, is she, Natsuki?

condition.saying:
Natsuki, you're being a real jerk.
I'm an adult, let me make choices for myself.

case.state: Well... this game's gettin' real weird already...
Wait, don't I get a say in this?!
...Your friend's got somethin' of a one-track mind, doesn't she, Miss Natsuki?
Don't wanna assume, but... you're sure eyein' up our heavenly company there, Natsuki.
Heh... I wouldn't guess you to like Kentucky fried chicken, Natsuki, but you sure look like you could go for some wings.

condition.saying: (~player~ or Pit..? Or maybe... ~player~ and Pit..!)

case.state: Heheheh... ain't young love somethin' special?
...Heh heh. You gotta admit, Revy, she captures your likeness well.
Well, it's just usual kinda regimen stuff - pushups, curls, and so on. But that's mostly just upkeep. The real trainin's in battle.
Heh, no less than I'd expect, Leonie. Consider it officially on.
Jesus... guess you weren't kiddin' about the zombie thing after all.
(Hm... 'least it looks like Sakura's holding up pretty well, even with the... zombie thing.)

Heh, sounds like your Lily'd be a kindred spirit with her. As for D.Va, she's apparently less of a singin' and dancin' idol like you and more of a pro-gamin' one. Scene's big enough that people like her get really big doin' it.
She's quite the character, for sure. And she's clearly a prodigy at her business... successful enough to afford to build her own war walker mech, anyway.
Well, it probably ain't that simple. Clearly I'm not the expert on the business here, but whatever x-factor there is, she's definitely done her research on it.
Actually yeah, between folk like Stukov, Kel'Thuzad, Stitches... not sure if Xul's one himself, but he's certainly fond of all the undead he raises up. Kinda creepy, but 'least he's friendly.

Well, the Nexus usually has a penchant for drawin' the toughest and nastiest kinda fighters around... though other times they come in the form of a sweet lil' panda girl or a peppy gnome. Never knew what to expect there.

For one, there's Li Li, the panda girl. She's quite the chipper one - only the worst folk there didn't hate when she got upset. Then there's D.Va... come to think of it, she's kind of an idol like you, actually.
A funk, huh... not a common reason you hear about enterin' entertainment, but it if worked, then it sure ain't a bad one.
This'll probably sound like the strangest thing I'll say this whole game, but... you ain't missin' out on much, Miss Galatea.

Couldn't agree more. Helpin' kids get a handle on controllin' it is one thing, but forcibly conscripting and brainwashing them is quite another. Thankfully we've started changing that in recent times.
Well, what about this other one you mentioned? Gotta be an interesting story there.
Oh, uh, that ain't what I'm talkin' about, Jessie. I'll admit I've been a bit curious lately, but I ain't uncomfortable with any of that.
O-Oh. Well, you don't need to worry about that, Jessie. I have been curious about the other side of the street, I'll admit, but it ain't nothin' I'm worried about.
...Mind if we change the subject, Jessie?
Heck, sometimes it's better to life if it'll avoid hurtin' people - like the time I didn't tell Tychus a drunk tattoo he got looked embarassing.
Heh, you don't think I died on my way here, do you, Jess? 'Cause this place is starting to look more and more like Heaven...
Well, I say that as someone who doesn't really like livin' large, Jess. A humble life on a farm's just about all I need.
Come on, don't tell me that's the weirdest thing you've heard after all you've seen, Jess.
Well... admittedly, if there was a time for me to do it, it'd be now. Real question is if I've still got game, though.
I tend to stick with Red Apple cigarettes. I like the sweet taste... though admittedly, I've been tryin' to cut back lately.
I guess if by small you mean drinkin' the last aged whiskey without askin', or bustin' up your ride by mistake. If they're truly apologetic, then I don't mind givin' a second chance.
Heck, with a pitch like that, Jess', maybe givin' up the ghost ain't so bad if I'm givin' it up to you.
Can't argue with that, Jess'. I ain't no wino, but I don't like losin' amenities like that neither.
Sorry, Jess', but I ain't the kinda guy who asks for much. I think you're definitely the bigger dreamer here.
Heh, well imagine that - wasn't expectin' I'd end up looking like the more adventurous one here tonight.
Alright, then - I'll leave it to you, Jess'. I'll make sure I put my best hand forward for you.
Hah, you don't say? Sounds like you've had quite the string of unforgettable adventures, Kumatora!
Haha, how about that? I knew friends can come in all shapes and sizes, but that's quite the unforgettable posse, Kumatora!
Oh, trust me - you've got no idea. Might be best if you never do.
It tastes good, and I'm not the worst drinker there ever was. That's what I keep tellin' myself, anyway.
Stimpacks? Wait... you're sayin' people take those for fun?
Heh, sounds to me like you're describin' ETC there. ETC. Of all the things I'd have expected to see in the Nexus, he was just about the last... and probably the best.
Heh, that's certainly a thought. Wonder if I could mix up some of your tunes into Tychus' sound system without him noticin'...

Well, it's another collidin' point of a whole ton of worlds, a bit like this place... 'cept instead of playin' cards, people get in teams and fight each other until one of their statues is blown up. And it's a lot bigger, too.
I mean, it's not like it was some passion for bein' a soldier that led me to it, just wantin' to help my parents at first... What about you? Why'd you get into the idol business?
...Hold up, this is on TV?! You ain't still jokin', are you?!
What, you think there's no need for farmin' just 'cause it ain't on your little Earth anymore?
...You strike me as bein' a bit too interested in that, Scuttlebutt.
Heh, just comes with the territory of bein' a soldier, Trifle. Especially when it comes to fightin' in the Koprulu Sector.
Gang members climbin' through windows, you said... Does that happen often at this school of yours?
(She seems like she's holding up alright with this... hope I was able to ease her into it better.)
Make up the details in your head, Scuttlebutt. That aint' somethin' I spill to just anyone.

condition.saying: You're built like a warrior monster. Specifically Cyber Commander. Is that your title in the military?

case.state: Heh, ain't ever had a title that fancy, sorry to say - my raiders just call me "Commander".
Sorry, compadre, but I don't really have much experience with the livin' dead. Uh, present company excluded, of course.
...If I'm makin' this awkward for you, Miss Natsuki, I'm real sorry.
Heh, you'll get there eventually, lil' devil. Don't worry.
Aww, well... how can I say no to such an honor?

No one's really sure... but they're responsible for creatin' much of the life in the universe, includin' the Zerg and Protoss. By this point, it wouldn't shock me if they turned out to be our creators too.

Well... from what we know, they seeded the universe with life countless times before they passed. The Protoss and Zerg may have been their main pride and joy, but... I don't know any better contenders to claim creatin' us too.
Hey, sometimes another perspective's all it takes, and I'd be happy to lend it. 'Specially if it means gettin' to spend some personal time with you.
Who know? If I can help you figure it out, then I'd be happy to learn more myself... 'specially if I get to learn more about you too.
...You know the sayin' about the land of the blind and the one-eyed man, Miss Cynthia? Well, Michael made sure no one who knew him would stay blind... even when the king was out for his blood.
...Koprulu ain't always an honest place, Miss Cynthia. Too many powerful folk try to hide what they've done... but Michael always made sure the truth wouldn't be forgotten, no matter the cost.
Apparently, it was supposed to be a controlled colonization much closer to Earth itself... until they overshot the destination and landed on Umoja, Moria, and Tarsonis about 28 years after.
From what we learned, it was originally an experiment to use prisoners to colonize a new planet near Earth. That is, until they went way off course and ended up in Koprulu 28 years later.
Well well well... alright, here's what I've got, Miss Cynthia: Tosh, the head of my Spectre agents? Apparently he had some flings with Nova - the Ghost agent who was tryin' to kill me not long ago.
Dang, you weren't jokin', Miss Cynthia... guess I gotta spill too. See, Nova, this Ghost agent who was tryin' to off me... apparently she used to be a bed buddy of my top Spectre agent, Tosh.
You won't regret it, trust me. They're hot enough to really feel it, but cooled just nicely enough to not burn you.
They're some of the best meat I've ever had, truly. And you can ask the chef to cook 'em just as crunchy or juicy as you like.
Nothing good, that's for sure. One of their own came to hate everything they'd created, and started workin' against them. Far as anyone knows, he's the last livin' one... to our misfortune.
For the most part, they ain't around no more. Save for one, who ended up killin' them all when they discovered him workin' against them. And lately, he's decided we're the next on his list.
Really now? Well, I'll be damned! How'd that happen - bunch of prisoners in a crazy experiment again, or somethin' else?
No kiddin'? Wouldn't have guessed! So how'd that come about - anything to do with your Pokemon there?
Nah, she was just followin' orders like a usual Dominion pet... though I wouldn't be surprised if she was still a bit bitter. She did try turnin' me against Tosh before.
I don't think so, it's usually just business for Ghosts... but now that you mention it, she did try convincin' me not to trust Tosh before.
Sounds like a plan to me, Cynthia! Plus, anything 'bout me you're interested in, all you need to do is ask.
Hey, learnin' both about you and your work sounds mighty fine to me, Cynthia! That goes both ways, by the by.
Hm... wonder whatever poor ol' us did to keep pissin' off these gods.
Almost makes you wonder... is there some unconscious reason they keep pickin' their beef with us?
No kiddin'? Well, it sounds like he made quite the discovery... far better than what we wound up with, anyway.
Talk about a groundbreakin' find... almost makes me envy the guy.
Somethin' up, ladies? Dunno what you're talking about, but from the looks on your faces...
Everythin' alright, ladies? Is there something you're talkin' about we should know?
If you're askin' if anyone here's a telepath, Megumin... well, I'd think this joint would have rules against those tricks.
Hm... how much do those golems go for? The Dominion could probably use several of 'em as of late.
"Mobile fortress", huh? Sounds kinda similar to the Zerg Leviathan my boys took down at Char.
Hm... don't really have an answer for that one, Miko. No use in frettin' over what you can't have, anyway.
Jeez, we'd be here all night if you're lookin' for mine, Saki. Don't think anyone has that kinda time... 'cept the Protoss, maybe.
Well, let's just say that if you played my life in reverse, I'd get my planet back, a whole lotta friends back, and... well, other folk too.
Man, where to even start with Sarah... lemme think for a bit.
(She said she's trying to make more friends... wonder if Johnny could've been the kind of kid she'd be friends with...)
I've heard some of my boys call it a "bullet hell". Don't know what that means, but it seems right up your alley either way, Nep.
On the bright side, I was given the courtesy of a much higher rankin' than her, so... if you ask me, I won in the end.
...Barkeep, put somethin' strong in my next drink. I don't care what it is.
Heard talk about this place from a few of my Raiders, Nep - mostly rumors, but I had to see for myself if it was real.
...Huh. Well hello to you too, Miss Galatea.
Hell, I dunno, Nami. Beat back the hybrid threat back in Koprulu, I guess... maybe live to see what comes after?
Heh, believe it or not, I did quite a bit of that not too long ago, compadre. And it wasn't the bogus type, neither.
Yeah, I definitely feel that too. Just wish she wasn't so fickle about things.
...Yeah, I done a bit like that before, compadre. But that was a long time ago, when I was a different man. At least, I like to think I was.
Sorry, compadre. I've fought off plenty of pirate captains before, but an undead one? Wouldn't even know where to start.
Actually, that's a bit of a tricky question, Brock... I've practiced with my sixgun the most, but I ain't slain nearly as many Zerg with it as I have my C-14.
I mean, yeah, but... bit of a heavier question, ain't it? Thought we all came here to relax.
...Huh. Well, sure, but... not exactly a light conversation topic there. Personally I'm tryin' to get away from that tonight.
Goin' exploring with a woman like you? Sounds like an offer I just can't refuse.
Explorin' with you, Miss Cynthia? Heh... if this were Koprulu, I'd say that sounds too good to be true.
'Fraid I wouldn't know about that, Miss Cynthia... 'course, I've learned plenty about the Xel'Naga, but they ain't really our creators... 'least, I don't think so...
I dunno... Michael Liberty, I guess? I mean, he's still alive, but there ain't too many historical figures in Koprulu who weren't just out for themselves.
Heh, quite the inqusitive spirit you got there, Cynthia... tell you what; share with me, and I'll share with you.
Hell, feels like I've been living through impactful history year after year lately... then again, the prison carrier crashes are the whole reason mankind exists in Koprulu to begin with.
'Fraid I wouldn't be the guy to ask, Nova... if we were in a Koprulu joint, I'd recommend askin' if they've got lava-seared Mutawings.
...Alright, fine. I'll leave it.
...Word of advice, Suz' - don't. A few of my boys tried that with stimpacks a while back, and it took hours to get it flushed outta their blood.
Last I checked, it was 2507... just how long have you been away, Suz'?
Actually, funny you should ask that, Suz'; I got some pals preparin' to go hunt a god right now... and knowin' my luck, I'll probably be roped in, too.
Yeah... I think I'll still have to pass on that offer, Suz'.
Hm... In my experience, whoever's doin' that sort of thing would probably have cloaked themselves... or burrowed, if you're real unlucky.
I mean, yeah, but... I think your and my definitions of "dark secrets" are a bit different.
I think everyone's got their own little lies to some extent, Jess. 'Long as they're honest enough to not keep any big or bad ones, it ain't no biggie.
Heh, well, I shouldn't risk bein' the blackest of the kettles here, right, Jess'?
...Nothin' more important, Jess'. By blood or no, family means always lookin' out for each other.
...Bein' honest, Jess'; I think I'd retire early. Might not sound that excitin', but by now, a quiet life would be real nice.
...Depends on what kinda mistakes, Jess'. I like to think I'm a forgivin' man, but... not everything deserves it.
On, but... only a little. There's somethin' kinda special about only seein' your partner when nothin' else in the world is nearby.
Nope. Bein' faithful's the only way if you ask me, Jess'... though it ain't like I've had much opportunity to date in the past several years.
Heh, do night elf holo-strippers count, Jess'? 'Cause the Hyperion bar's got one of those runnin' 24/7.
Heheh, you sure know how to grease the wheels, don't you? Alright, compadre, consider it a deal... just hope you're ready to go down hard. A country boy never holds back.
...I'm sorry, what? That's a... bit of a forward question, ain't it?
Well, if you're buyin... why not try somethin' new? I'll take a bottle of Corky's Cactus Juice.
Hm... wonder just how different that would've turned out, doc. At the very least, I'd take it over the Confederacy corps any day.
I've seen many beautiful planets, doc... but gettin' to see the Dark Templar homeworld of Shakuras myself is a privilage I'll never forget.
...I'd tell him to be more careful with who he trusts, Lucina. And to not let the ones he does trust go alone.
Well... it's a real mixed bag, Lucy. On the one hand, there's near-constant war and fighting... but on the other hand, there's a lot worth fightin' for.
Think of a world lit entirely by moonlight, Ms. Penny. That's what the view of the planet Shakuras is like.
Wait... So you grabbed enough cash to come out here, but you forgot how much you'd need to get back? Who does that?
Heh, I certainly like to think so. Kinda wish I'd ended up in an outfit like yours instead of the Confederacy Corps, truth be told.
I don't think you need to worry about that, Kumatora. My dad told me it's always proper courtesy to remember someone's name, however odd it may be.
Now that's a good question, Kumatora. Guess if I had to pick, I'd go with a plate of lava-seared muta-wings. Can't go wrong with those.
Really? Well, my curiosity's been unexpectedly piqued, Ms. Tao. Let me hear what you've got.
Well, I never pass up the opportunity to talk about farmin' with people whenever it comes up. Not that it often does, though.
Hell, we farmed just about anything you can imagine, boss. Grain, fruits, vegetables, and a whole lotta livestock.
Aww, man... Startin' to think you're too good for any of us sinners here, Nagisa.
If you're seriously thinkin' about bulking up, there's a whole ton of places you could start. Your school probably has some fitness clubs or sports, right?
("Conk"... shouldn'ta said that. Sounds too much like "cock". Now everyone's gonna think I hit my cock on the doorway.)
So there's gods in this joint too? Don't suppose any 'a you hung with the Xel'Naga?
Fightin' anything nasty where you're from, ~militarytarget~? Hopefully nothin' capable of glassing whole planets...
So, ~militarytarget~ , what kinda hardware you got? Anything capable of outclassin' a battlecruiser?
Koprulu ain't one of the places you watch over or somethin', is it, ~deitytarget~? Kinda hopin' the answer's no...
Anything you wanna talk about, ~gloomytarget~? You look like something's eatin' away at ya.
You doin' okay, ~gloomytarget~? I can buy you a drink, if you want.
So, what's your outfit like, ~militarytarget~? I sure hope it's at least better than the Confederacy corps was.
Got any good war stories? This place is like a hodgepodge of everything outside Koprulu, so there's gotta be juicy stuff.
The place you came from turned out pretty differently than the place I'm from, didn't it, ~futuretarget~ ? Sure hope it's not for the worse...
You people got any good neighbors, ~futuretarget~ ? The Protoss where I come from are a bit odd, but they're actually pretty cool once you know 'em.
It's nice havin' you around, ~cheerfultarget~. Hell, I think you and Swann would get along famously.
Gotta say, ~cheerfultarget~, I like your attitude. Kinda wish I had it in recent times...
You're one of those sword-and-sorcery types, ~fantasytarget~? This place wouldn't happen to be in the Nexus, would it?
Heh, no matter how many times I see you fantasy folk, ~fantasytarget~, it'll always feel weird as hell.
We sure ~insanetarget~ should be here? ~insanetarget.ifMale(He's|She's)~ actin' like ~insanetarget.ifMale(he|she)~ just inhaled a whole silo of Terrazine before coming here...
Anyone here won anything real big from a game like this before? My man Matt accidentally got married thanks to cards, believe it or not.
So how'd y'all get here, anyway? Had to pass through an entire intergalactic sector just to find this planet.
Name's Jim Raynor, by the way. Marshal, outlaw, commander... but just another player at the table tonight.
While we're introducin' ourselves, my name's Jim Raynor. Came all the way from the Koprulu Sector to get here - hope it doesn't disappoint.
Oh, by the way, I'm Jim Raynor. Started comin' here to take a much-needed break from things.
Gotta think hard about my next move... might as well give y'all a good view in the meantime.
No sense in lettin' the situation go to waste, right? Now, what if I tried...
Hmm... Well, I may not win this one, but I'll definitely end up creatin' some new ideas in your heads.
Hey, mind playin' some Liberty Rock in here? Much obliged.
None of you are from Koprulu, are ya? It's never a dull place, I can say that much.
Hey, barkeep! How we doin' on that Scotty Bolger's no. 8?
This joint's cards are way nicer than what we've got on the Hyperion. Must'a had those for years...
Mind switching to the next song? I'm in the mood for some Johnny Cash.
Y'know, Koprulu ain't all bad. I'd love to show you all Vardona or Tyrador IX sometime.
Well, bein' a chief and all, I'm sure you know that leadership ain't for everyone. Certainly not a fella like him.
No idea what world he's come from, but it couldn't have been a very hard one.

condition.saying: Nice to see another vigilante!

case.state: Heh... that's certainly nicer than what Mengsk's usual word choices were.
...Wait, what the hell even is a "himbo"---
Well, you'll be happy to know I don't, Noire. Actually, I lead a rebellion against tyranny - until recently, that is.
Nah, we don't have actual dragons in the Koprulu sector, Noire. This just represents the Battle of Dragon Ridge.
We got railguns, alright - but none of them fit in a compact frame like this just yet. This here's a Colt Single Action Army - it still uses old-fashioned lead.
Well, we still ain't at the point of havin' weapons that powerful on compact sidearm frames yet, Noire. The Colt Single Action Army's as classic as it gets.
Rest assured, Noire, it ain't nothin' like that. Actually, fightin' tyranny's exactly what I formed my Raiders around to begin with.
Well, a lot of 'em I just got 'cause they look cool. But others like that dragon represent past victories - triumphs I wanna remember.
I'm the leader of Raynor's Raiders, Ms. Noire. We're a rebel group... or were, anyway.
Well, not all of 'em mean somethin', Noire. But the ones that do tend to represent past victories for the Raiders.
I got some of these tats to commemorate past victories for the Raiders, Noire. Others, I just thought they looked good.
I'd be delighted, Noire. This here's a Colt Single Action Army - a model that's hundreds of years old now. It's one of the most reliable sidearms ever made.
Don't mind if I do, Noire. What I've got on my hip is an old classic: the Colt Single Action Army. It's somethin' of a collector's item - there ain't many like it.
Don't really fight "for" anyone, Noire. Not no more, anyway - been leadin' a resistance movement of my own for several years now.
Think I'll go with my gloves first. Sorry if it ain't the most excitin' choice just yet.
Lotta good lookers around here tonight, huh, boss? Almost makes me feel bad I didn't come here wearing somethin' better.
You know, you shouldn't write off farmgirls that easily, boss. I've seen plenty of girls who got pretty jacked - enough to rival some men I know.
You know, folks back on Shiloh always loved to brag about how hardy we were compared to most other colonies. Wasn't sure myself whether it was true or if it was just hot air.
Truth be told, boss, war and Koprulu are kinda inseperable. Feels like each war's just led into a new one the past few decades.
Well, however things are goin' in Koprulu, I hope it's at least much better back on old Earth, boss.
Damn, I must be more outta practice than I thought. Been a hot minute since I last played any cards with the Raiders.
If you don't mind me sayin', I'm impressed you stuck around this long, boss. Wasn't sure if you'd lose your nerve sooner.

condition.saying: It's hard to admit, but magic can't solve every problem. It's good to see you're so versed in technology, ~name~... but if you really want to enjoy stuff, magic is the way to go!

case.state: Don't have to tell me twice. I've seen people do all sorts of amazin' stuff with psionics... 'course, I'm less of a fan when my boys are on the recievin' end.

condition.saying: ~Name~! All your stuff looks hi-tech! Do you know about magic, though? A lot of witches are old-fashioned, but an old professor of mine mixed the two together.

case.state: Sounds like how we outfit our Ghosts - givin' them equipment that kinda enhances their psionics and makes them a helluva lot deadlier.

condition.saying: You're so nice, ~Name~, can I do something nice for you? Like... make your clothes look cuter? Give you a little float spell?

case.state: Heh, well, if you insist, kid... any chance you can conjure up a plate of grilled Zergling thighs?

condition.saying: You look a little long in the tooth, Cowboy. There's not a lotta older guys where I work, if you get what I mean.

case.state: {small}Not everyone's cut out for the whole fightin' and killin' business, after all. Unfortunately, it's often not too long before they find out the hard way.{!reset}

condition.saying: There's a rare sight--a guy who's not fresh off his mom's tit. Rare for me, anyway--if a guy's past his twenties where I work, you know he's for real.

case.state: You sound pretty seasoned yourself, partner. You work as a mercenary in this sector?

condition.saying: ...You're a fellow space traveler? I suppose it's nice to meet a man in a non-hostile situation.

case.state: Tell me about it. These days, if I meet someone who ain't already out for my blood, it's a right relief.

condition.saying: I'm glad someone else here has experience in space travel, even if it's a man. Our crew's previous encounters with them have quickly devolved into conflict.

case.state: You're part of some kinda all-female crew? Didn't know some sectors even had those.

condition.saying: Oh, what's this? You're a more rugged man than I'm used to--and I hear you're a space traveler, too? It's a shame you're a little old for me.

case.state: Traveler's certainly one way of puttin' it. Feels like I've been everywhere in Koprulu by this point.

condition.saying: What a pleasant surprise to meet another spacefarer, and a man at that. Say, you wouldn't happen to have any young, handsome companions, would you?

case.state: Hmm... come to think of it, I think you might take quite a likin' to Matt, Miss Jura. Best man I know.

condition.saying: Why is it that every rogue spacefaring man we meet is old and grizzled? I'm too much of a gorgeous, delicate young thing for you.

case.state: Heh, you're certertainly not one to mince words, are you, Miss Jura? Not that you're wrong, of course.

condition.saying: There's something I've been worrying about for a while

case.state: Shoot away, kiddo. I'm an open book.
...Conditioner? Hair...? You wanna slow down there for a sec, man?
'Unusual'? First time my body's been described thatway.
Fanciest thing I've drank, huh? Probably Old Chattanooga - the company behind Scotty Bolger's made and marketed it as a sort of "higher-class" booze.
Definitely the Vulture. It's a beautiful classic of engineering - anyone who's been into biking long enough's ridden one.
...Mind elaboratin' on that, pal? Not sure I see much pullin' us together at the moment.
Real interestin' place so far. Smaller than the last multiverse center I went to, but way more relaxin'.
Well, I've had my CMC suit ever since the days of the Guild Wars, and the modern C-14's just about the most reliable rifle you can find.
Well, I'm not sure I have any real type, other than maybe... wait, why are you askin'?
Hm? What're you talkin' about, pal?
...Excuse me? That damn propaganda is still floatin' around?
Yep, pretty much. Got just the right amount of zest and bitterness to it.
Well... it's kinda more complicated than that, Ms. Monika. Apparently, warp space is a whole separate reality entirely.
Kind of, but... not really. It ain't just a change in reality, Ms. Monika, it's a separate reality entirely.
Yeah, I've noticed that too. You don't tend to find many folks still early-20s in places like these, 'least where I'm from.
I get some downtime, yeah, but even then I'm prepared for things to get hectic. Livin' as a rebel commander means you can't really let your guard down.
...Is there a solid reason you're phrasin' it like that, Mari?
I mean, I wouldn't say I knew what I was expectin'. I really just- wait...
...Mari, are you tryin' to seduce me?
...Have you thought hard about what you're goin' for here, Mari?
It's alright, boss. I came to terms with it a while ago, and I can't let it bother me no more.
Intense is one way of puttin' it, Miss Aoba. I'm a revolution leader - not sure there's much else more intense than that.
Well, for the past several years I've been leadin' a revolution - "intense" seems pretty accurate, yeah.

condition.saying: Mr. Jim

case.state: What...? Oh, hey, look - it ain't like that, I promise you that I-

condition.saying: Lighten up a little

case.state: I mean, I ain't arguin' against that. But I'm still tryin' to wrap my mind around what you're offerin' to begin with.

condition.saying: my tech a tune-up

case.state: ...Still not givin' up on tryin' to win me over, are you, Dorothy?

condition.saying: stronger guys like you

case.state: Of course - I don't like the thought of just tryin' to pump-and-dump someone, regardless of whether they're flesh or metal.

condition.saying: I might be a flirt

case.state: Really, now? In what kinda ways, Dorothy?

condition.saying: Why, hello there, big boy. What's your name?

case.state: Name's Jim Raynor. Sorry if I'm late on introductions, it's just kinda nice to be somewhere relaxing for a change.
Pretty much, yeah. Helped my parents on their farm ever since I was old enough to lift a pitchfork.
That's right. My mom and dad always needed help 'round the farm, and family always pitches in how they can.
Right you are, kiddo. Feels like a lifetime since I was just lil' farmboy Jimmy, though.

condition.saying: Despite herself, she's a little intimidated.

case.state: ...What's your story, kiddo? You don't exactly strike me as someone who frequents this joint much.
{small}Oh. Well, yeah, pretty much. They've all got different biomes, different critters, different weather... we're still a long way from knowin' them all fully.{!reset}
Sittin' pretty while my boys and girls risk dyin' for me ain't my style, Revy. 'Sides, we never had a numbers advantage anyway.
Well, a rebel group's hardly the kinda place to be an armchair general, Revy. Everyone's gotta get in the thick of it if they can.
We never really had a surplus of volunteers, Revy - every fighter counts. If I ain't willin' to get dirty for the cause, why should they?
Heh, I'm flattered, Deimos. I think this is the first joint I've been to in a while where there ain't many folks built like me.
Well thanks, Deimos. Couldn't help but notice... there ain't much in the way of muscle 'round here, is there?
That's right, Miss Meia - been leadin' them for the better part of six years now. Most call us "Raynor's Raiders".
Yep - Koprulu knows us as "Raynor's Raiders". Certainly nice to meet another resistance group, must say.

condition.saying: I guess if I asked you if you were a fan of Franchouchou now, it'd be a little strange, right?

case.state: Well, can't say I've ever tuned in to songs by the livin' dead before... 'course, my dad always said there's a first for everythin'.

condition.saying: So... Jim! Franchouchou actually has fans of all ages and demographics!

case.state: Heh, and I'm guessin' you're tryin' to make some new ones outside your usual world, Miss Sakura?

condition.saying: Y-you look like someone who's really good at fighting zombies.

case.state: I mean, I've tussled with my fair share of the undead... why do you ask?

condition.saying: You know, I was really worried you'd be one of those zombie killers.

case.state: {small}Well... I may have fought my fair share of 'em, but they were far from pleasant. And I wouldn't have it in me to go after a sweetheart like you.{!reset}
{small}Well... civilized as they are, they're actually pretty different from us. Near everythin' in their society's based around their psychic link - the "Khala".{!reset}
Hm... they're similar in some ways, sure, but most of what they do is based around the "Khala". It's basically a psychic link of sorts.
{small}Well, there's apparently a whole caste system that was created around the Khala - leaders, warriors, and workers, based on how in-touch they are with it.{!reset}
{small}The caste system, definitely - based on how strong they are with the Khala, a Protoss ends up in the worker, warrior, or leader group after some time.{!reset}
C'mon, Polly, it's been a while since my last game. Don't exactly have all the time in the world.

condition.saying: 'kill zombies' smile

case.state: {small}Heheh, I was just thinkin'... ever thought about pretendin' you've actually got a hankerin' for human flesh? Specifically, the flesh of this producer of yours?{!reset}
There's been more of an effort recently, sure. But... well, just a few years ago, we were tryin' to wipe each other out by the shipload.
Up until recently... not really. Actually, I was kinda the first terran they ever came to trust.
Wouldn't have believed it myself years ago... guess it goes to show how you can find pals even in the oddest of places.
Nothin' complicated, Ms. Granger - my pal Matt thought I'd been workin' myself too hard lately, so he suggested I take a night off.
Well, let's just say that this is my first little vacation in quite some time, Ms. Granger - been workin' so much on usual business lately that my man Matt was gettin' worried about me.
Well, I always liked to think of that as my strong suit. Keep thinkin' on your feet and leave your opponents guessin'.

condition.saying: kinda scare me

case.state: Really now? Was it somethin' I said earlier?
"Scruffy and dadlike", huh? Never been called that before... still, sounds like I'd like him already.
Hey, it's always nice talkin' with a soldier who isn't out to kill me. 'Sides, it wouldn't be the first I've talked with one of those medieval knight-types.
Some of 'em, sure. Commemorations of successful battles. Others I just got 'cause I liked the look.
Nah, it's just a comfort kinda thing. Feels better to have around, and it ain't quite so obvious or off-puttin' as a rifle.
Well, what do you "do" on Earth, Ms. Monika? Folks from the Koprulu Sector ain't all there like they just transferred for work or somethin'.
I mean it ain't like Koprulu's some big empty void - we got planets just like this one. Way you phrase it makes it sound like some kinda job hotspot.
Pretty standard; born to a pair of farmers, helped with their work whenever I could. Granddad taught me to hunt and shoot. Got a good education too. Not too interestin', I'm afraid.
Well... former outlaw is more like it. Conventionally, anyway. That's a life I left behind a long time ago.
It's... complicated. Part of me knows it can happen, and I wanna do whatever I can to hold out until then, but... the other part of me knows there's barely a snowball's chance of that.
Not really, no. Been so concerned lately with survivin' that my romantic life practically feels like a long-lost dream by this point.
Haven't met many guys built like me where you come from, huh? That ain't a problem or anything, is it?
Pretty much, yeah. My line of work's kept me so busy as of late that people started gettin' concerned, said I should take some time off. I figured I might as well check out here.
I'd say so. Things have been gettin' pretty stressful where I'm from, so people were recommendin' I take some time off - decided to finally check this place out.
Yep. Sorry if it sticks out - I've got no intention to use it here, really.
That it is. Don't worry, Sucrose, I don't plan to use it at all while I'm here.
Pal, from the looks of you, I wouldn't throwin' out rocks in a glass house like that. Gore ain't exactly a pleasant smell either.
Pretty broad definition if you're countin' the Zerg as "animals", Jason... but yeah, you're right.
Wait... this is a summer camp you're talkin' about, right? Seems pretty neglectful to just set up traps near a place like that.
Well, I did--- wait, are you blushin'?
...I've fought in multiple wars, Monika. And both of those answers apply to different ones.
...Depends on which war you're talkin' about, Monika. Either of those answers could be true.
Sorry to disappoint you, Missy. I take it that description matches someone you knew?
...Maybe. What's it to you?
...Let's say you're right. So what?
I don't know the exact extent, but I'd assume pretty far. I know pretty much all the habitable systems around Earth's solar system have been colonized by this point, at least.
Often it was the Zerg - terrifyin' group of aliens that consumed all they came across. Thankfully a lot of 'em are tamer now, but... we ain't gonna forget their past destruction easily.
Well, there's the Protoss. They don't have the best history with terrans, but I've actually managed to earn quite a bit of their trust, for what that's worth.
I've always served right on the ground, side-by-side with my boys and girls. Sometimes on foot, sometimes on a vulture bike, but either way, I ain't no stranger to scrappin' up close and personal.
Heh, wish I had a different answer, but nope. God knows somethin' like that would sure help put my mind at ease.
Right you are, Kumatora. Had this ol' piece with me for years... though it ain't been my main draw in a while.
That's one way of puttin' it, Kumatora. It ain't usually the gun I first go for in a fight, but I never leave home without it.
Haha! Sorry to disappoint you, Kumatora. I was born and raised on the planet of Shiloh, and ain't nothin' can change that.
Hah! Well, what makes you so sure you just ain't got the lineage of a Shiloh family, Kumatora? You've certainly got the heart for it!
Sorry, but I don't intend to skimp over the rules of the game. 'Specially not when everyone else's been playin' fair.
Hate to disappoint you, but I ain't playin' any way but fair. I figured the boots might have to go eventually anyway.
Well, it's nice to meet you too, Miss Furukawa. Don't take this the wrong way, but you weren't exactly the type I figured I'd see at a place like this.
I was born in 2470, boss. Probably not a year that means much to you, does it?
Mad? Wait... is there a reason you've been glancin' at my gun like that?
Mad? Wait... is there a reason you've been glancin' at my gun like that?
Well... no. I was once, but not anymore.
Sure do, boss. When fightin' in the Koprulu sector, it pays to stay in the best shape of your life.
Don't worry, boss, it's alright - I wouldn't have come here if I was squeamish about that anyway.
Well, I'm flattered to know that, Nagisa. But you don't have to worry - I think I've grown accustomed to it by now.
Heh, that eager to get on my good side, Cagliostro? And yeah, I like to think I'm pretty knowledgable on that.
Heh, you ain't shy when it comes to flatterin' people, are you, Cagliostro? But yeah, I know my stuff alright.
Man, tell me about it. Bad luck and me feel like two peas in a pod sometimes.
Jeez, that's too real. I've learned many times over that bettin' on hope is a fools' errand.
Heh, no need to be so sheepish about it, man. 'Specially considering where we are, after all.
'Fraid it ain't anything that special, Anatoly, It's probably more owed to years of fightin' in the Koprulu Sector.
Heh, 'fraid I ain't got some big secret to share, Gloria. Just good ol' military trainin' and constant fighting.
Heh, well, it ain't like it's some special trick, Gloria. A lifetime of military service tends to get you pretty jacked.
...Well, that's one hell of a way to start this off for me, Mary.
Well... suppose I can spill, but after all you've probably heard and done, it might be pretty borin', Dorothy.
Heh, for someone callin' herself a demon, you sure are a far cry from the wicked an' evil sort, ain't ya?
Well, you sure are a lot nicer than what people usually think of when they hear "demon", aren't you?
That's right, Miss Yunyun... though I think that goes for most people here, don't it?
I do, Miss Yunyun... though the stuff you talk about sounds pretty impressive too.
Saki... you've talked about your sisters plenty tonight. You look out for 'em good?
Heh, consider me flattered, Ms. Senko. First time I've met a pretty young fox lady like yourself.
Well, aren't you a charmer, Ms. Senko? Didn't guess an older guy like me would catch a younger eye like yours.
You can call me whatever you want, Blake. I'm glad to hear you feel comfortable 'round me, in any case.

condition.saying: Well... well... now this little game of strip poker became a big bit interesting.

case.state: 'Fraid it won't be too interestin' just yet, Miss Amy - 'less you're a glove collector, of course.

condition.saying: Hey, Jim! Can you take me shooting after this?

case.state: Really now? Didn't think you'd be the type to be interested in shootin', Miss Amy.

condition.saying: So... just putting it out there, I just turned 18.

case.state: O-kay... good for you, Miss Amy.

condition.saying: I hope you're not too embarrassed by little old me flirting with you.

case.state: I mean... mostly I'm not even really sure what I should be feelin' right now. Besides suspicious of daddy issues.

condition.saying: Seriously though, it's not surprising I'd find you attractive, is it?

case.state: Look, Amy - I'm flattered, but there's gotta be tons of other boys who like you, right? I'm sure you can do way better than someone like me.
Oh yeah, I mentioned Valerian. He's... well, the old bastard I brought up earlier was his daddy.
Oh, right, what I said just earlier. Well... believe it or not, he's the kid of the tyrant I was tellin' you about.
Heh, thanks... though I pity all the wise men you know if you think I'm comparable.
Consider me flattered, Laevatein... still, not the first word I'd use to describe myself.
Hmm... what kinda change are you lookin' to bring, Laevatein? You got my curiosity by the jewels.
Sounds like you've got your priorities pretty straight then... though I gotta ask, what change is it you want?
Is that how a lot of folk are treated in your world, Laevatein? As just pawns on a board?
Yeah... I'm guessin' you've seen a lot of that sorta thing, Laevatein?
Damn... sounds like she really cared about you.
If you don't mind me askin'... what was she like?
Yeah... ask me, anyone who disagrees should be kept far way from any position of authority. Otherwise, you get stuff like Mengsk, and the Confederacy before him.
Indeed... between Mengsk and the Confederacy before him, I've seen too much of people bein' used as disposable tools to stomach it.
Well, it ain't anywhere near this planet - it's a long ways out near where the Milky Way ends. No one ever told me we have giants there, though.

condition.saying: alien life

case.state: From what I've read about 'em... well, I'm actually kinda grateful to be living in Koprulu instead for once. I'll take what we've got over inescapable imperialism.
Actually, yeah; we've got our own history books about 'em. Frankly, bein' far away from those imperialist bastards makes life in Koprulu sound cushy for once.
I'm glad to hear that, Laevatein... just hope the circumstances haven't detracted from it at all.
That's real good, Laevatein... funny, wouldn't have guessed a conversation during a strip poker game could end up described as "enlightening."
Heh, that's one way of puttin' it, Ms. Setogaya. Though most folks where I'm from could be called "space-people" in one way or another.
Well, that's a question with a pretty big answer, Heris. They've got just as many differences from us as they do things in common.
Alright, so... it's like this: People have often wondered about what it'd take to travel through space without takin' too long, right?
Got it. So... I'm sure you've at least wondered once or twice how people could travel through space in a way that's practical, right?
Yeah, that's pretty much the short version. There's a lot more nitty-gritty to it, but I ain't no scientist.
More or less, yeah. There's finer details to it, of course, but I don't quite got the know-how or time to explain it all.
Not sure, sorry to say... My favorite is Scotty Bolger's Old No.8, but that might be a bit too hard for you, Fina.
Nothin' I'm sure I can recommend, Fina. Unless you're lookin' for something pretty hard, in which case there's Scotty Bolger's Old No. 8.
Well, sure hope it doesn't come down to that. Never was much with the former, and the latter's slipped me by these past few years.
Feelin' the odds are stacked against me, Nami? Sure hope I won't need to rely on luck, then...
Heh, no way. The kinda price that was on my head, I'd be shot dead the instant I walked into a bounty joint.
Not a chance, Nami. Most of my name may be cleared now, but I reckon plenty of bounty joints still got a death wish for me.

condition.saying: Your face... so world weathered...

case.state: Well, when you've seen and been through a lot, it tends to leave a mark on you... in more ways than one.

condition.saying: It feels strange... how relatively good-natured you come off. It's not a bad thing by any means, just-- surprising.

case.state: Well, thank ya. I just figure there ought to be more good will in the world to balance out all the nastiness.

condition.saying: Ah yes... you. The world-weathered man. Jim, was it?

case.state: Yep. What's on your mind, Miss Galatea?

condition.saying: Wow, I didn't expect a man of my age to show up in a game like this. So, what brings you here, Jim? Winding down from a long, exhausting day at work?

case.state: You could say that, yeah - Matt's worried I haven't been takin' enough time for myself lately, so I decided to swing by here.

condition.saying: It's not everyday I meet a man my age in a strip poker game. I wonder if you came here for the same reason I did, Jim. That would be very convenient for both of us.

case.state: Heh, well, I think just about everyone comes to a strip poker game for the same thing, don't they?

condition.saying: I'm so used to seeing younger men here that I almost doubted that older men were allowed to play this game. I bet we came here for the same thing, Jim.

case.state: {small}Sure are a lot of young folk 'round this joint, aren't there? Kinda wonder if we're the oldest ones here... 'course, you've certainly aged better.{!reset}

condition.saying: I bet you've experienced a lot of things, Jim. Can you tell me some of those, dear? I'm dying to know what you do for a living.

case.state: {small}Well, you'll sure get no shortage of stories from me, Jess. You see a lot when you tussle with the nastier parts of Koprulu... for better and for worse.{!reset}

condition.saying: Surely, you have a lot of stories to tell to me, Jim. You look like you have a very interesting job, and I'd appreciate it if you can tell me about it.

case.state: {small}Well, leadin' a revolution's less of a job and more like a full-time volunteer position... one that you can't quit, but you're always in danger of losin'.{!reset}

condition.saying: So, when you found out you'd be playing strip poker, did you choose to stock up on every ammo holder you could find?

case.state: Nah, just wear 'em most of the time anyway. Can't act like it ain't helpin' me out right now, though.

condition.saying: You're a big guy, huh?

case.state: Guess so. Hopin' that's not a bad thing?

condition.saying: So, you're a pretty professional soldier, huh? What kind of guns do you use--

case.state: Well, most often I use a good ol' C-14 like most of my boys, but I've also got a fondness for my HEV rifle when trouble gets big.

condition.saying: Jim, what kind of person did you want to meet here tonight, anyway?

case.state: Hey now, who says I'm lookin' for someone tonight?

condition.saying: Jim...what is the Koprulu Sector? It sounds like a kracken's wet dream...

case.state: {small}Well, Koprulu's one of the furthest parts of the Milky Way out there; and one of the nastiest, to boot. Bein' honest, a kracken would be one of the less worryin' things there.{!reset}

condition.saying: The uh...Koprulu...whatever? What is it? Sounds like a sea monster haven or something.

case.state: Sure ain't far from the truth, kid. Though between the Zerg and sea monsters, I'll take the latter any day of the damn week.

condition.saying: Could you explain what a Koprulu is? I'm guessing it's a Pokmon but I'm probably wrong...

case.state: {small}Your guess' about as good as mine, really. I've heard it apparently means "bridged" in some old Earth language, but I sure ain't no expert.{!reset}

condition.saying: Could you tell us what your tattoos are all about? They look interesting.

case.state: {small}Well, some I just got 'cause I thought they looked cool, but others are kinda marks of past victories. Some of my best soldiers have the same ones.{!reset}

condition.saying: What's the story behind your tattoos, Jim? Got any shanties to share?

case.state: Heh, 'fraid I don't have any shanties; that's what I keep a jukebox for. Most of 'em do have a story, though.

condition.saying: Those tats look cool, Jim. What'd you get 'em for?

case.state: {small}Well, some were just for fun, but others are mementos of past missions - you can actually find some of these on a few of my boys as well.{!reset}

condition.saying: Is that you, John Wayne? Is this me?

case.state: ...Who said that?

condition.saying: Sir Raynor, I can tell you to be a rebellious man. But I also sense you have a strong sense of justice rooted in your soul. Well met.

case.state: Well, can't remember the last time someone gave me such a fancy greeting. Pleased to meet you here too, pal.

condition.saying: Sir Raynor, I hardly need to use my abilities to tell youve been entangled in some battles. Who, pray tell, is your adversary?

case.state: Yeah... that'd be Mengsk. Probably the most twisted and corrupt scumbag to ever live in Koprulu. He's killed millions just for himself, and fooled their families into thinking he's their savior.
Heh, there's always somethin' special about meetin' a fellow biker. Wasn't sure if I'd even find any in this joint.
Heh, there's always somethin' special about meetin' a fellow biker. Wasn't sure if I'd even find any in this joint.

condition.saying: So whatre you n your buddies all about? Ya got your own motorbike club or somethin?

case.state: Heh, 'fraid not. I mean, people do know about the big, bad Vulture bikers in Raynor's Raiders, but they're hardly the main army.
Heh, this place doesn't get folks like me often, does it? Nearly hit my conk on the doorway comin' in here.
Heh, well, a fighter and a leader should stay in shape, and that goes double for anyone in Koprulu.
Well, I hate to disappoint someone like you, Jess', but... not exactly.
Well... yeah, I guess you could call it that.

condition.saying: Well... you look formidable...

case.state: Heh, thanks. There aren't exactly a whole lotta other folk like me here, are there?
Consider me, flattered, Miss. I take it there aren't exactly a lotta other well-built types here, eh?

condition.saying: You lead a band of raiders right, Jim? What's your purpose.

case.state: {small}Our purpose was revolution and reformation, Laevatein... for the most part, anyway. Me, I think I mostly just wanted to make an old bastard pay.{!reset}

condition.saying: So, Jim. This raiders group you lead. Why do you fight?

case.state: {small}Well, the past several years we mostly spent fightin' the Dominion - picture just about every greedy, spiteful regime you know, and that's them. Or how they used to be, anyway.{!reset}

condition.saying: Yer a ruggedly handsome man, Jimbo. There somebody you got yer eye on, once all yer heroics are no longer needed?

case.state: ...Yeah, you could say that. Bein' frank, though, I don't know if that day'll ever come.
Well, it's been a while since I really had the time for some biking, but I sure ain't no stranger to it, either.
Guess you could say that - 'course, it's been a while, but I ain't ready to give up my old vulture just yet.

condition.saying: So, ~name~, Ive gotta ask, does your unit use any Kaibacorp weapons?

case.state: Kaibacorp? Heard a whole lotta arms companies before, but never that one...

condition.saying: So, ~name~. Do you play card games when you're on duty? I'm sure Duel Monsters is popular with your platoon.

case.state: "Duel Monsters"? Ain't ever heard of that one before, and I've heard nearly all 'a them.

condition.saying: I'm sure your weapons are quite cool. I've never fired a gun in my life, but I'm sure they bang and shoot and send people to the hospital just like they're supposed to.

case.state: Yeah, that's about right. 'Course, we usually go for sendin' them beyond the hospital, but in our defense they're doin' the same.

condition.saying: Who do you work for, ~name~? And if you say it's a demon hand from space, I must politely ask you to leave.

case.state: {small}Heh, ain't workin' for no one no more, kid - least of all that. Doesn't strike me as the type to be too interested in freein' people from tyranny.{!reset}

condition.saying: So, ~name~, what enemies do you fight? Are they true enemies of democracy? Or is this just a war fought to benefit corporate interests, like my brothers' companies?

case.state: {small}If you're talkin' 'bout the Dominion, then yeah, they were as far away from a democracy as you can think. Nastiest bunch around... 'sides the Zerg, that is.{!reset}

condition.saying: My brothers are into every industry, but they're understandably reluctant to dig too deply into alien tech.

case.state: Why not? The way you talk, I figured you and your family think they got near everything figured out for yourselves.

condition.saying: My family was perfectly willing to hire all those poor military technicians who didnt deserve to be fired.

case.state: You sure got quite the ego for someone whose bottom line is your only line, kid. Your family actually done anythin' worth doin'?

condition.saying: So, ~name~, do you have a signifigant other? I bet they're worried sick being away from you for so long. I couldn't imagine being away from Alexis for years at a time.

case.state: Yeah... hope she ain't worryin' too much. I'm twice as worried for her own sake.

condition.saying: Jeez. You look... like a comic book character. An American comic book character...

case.state: Heh, then I certainly hope those are the good ones, Miss Natsuki.

condition.saying: Jim, I've got a question for you.

case.state: Then I might have an answer for you, Miss Natsuki. Go right ahead.

condition.saying: ~Player~ might be kind of a lame jerk, but you're nice, Jim. I guess I shouldn't have judged a book by its cover.

case.state: Hey, don't sweat it. I realize I kinda stick out from the usual crowd here.

condition.saying: Ha. Jim socks.

case.state: Hm? I--- wait... heh heh. Okay, lil' devil, that was good.
What's up, lil' devil? You look like you got somethin' eating at you.

condition.saying: So, are you one of those people that gets to fight in a space suit, or powered armor?

case.state: Right you are, Miss Sakura. I've had the same CMC suit ever since the Guild Wars, and I keep puttin' it to good use.
Hm... from time to time, sure. Heavy question, ain't it?
Geez, now that's a big question right there. Still... I guess I have.
...Yeah, sometimes. Didn't know I was gonna be facin' some personal topics tonight.
Better, for sure. These are still some real tough times, but at least the people have leaders they can trust.
Yeah. Rebuildin's far from over, of course, but there ain't no twisted types controllin' everything no more.
{small}I've done a whole lot of things in my time, Nep - though all of 'em seem to involve holdin' a gun and fightin' some real nasty things in one way or another.{!reset}
{small}Well, I guess you could say that's where the muscles you pointed out earlier come in, Nep. I've been a soldier and a fighter ever since I came of age.{!reset}

condition.saying: So, do you have someone you report to? Sometimes I wonder if my producer would've been better in the military!

case.state: ...Ah. That kind of jerk, huh?

condition.saying: body armor

case.state: {small}Nah, I save the CMC suit when I expect to be fightin' for my life. The cartriges on those things don't last forever... and the septic system ain't exactly comfy, either.{!reset}
Sorry to say, but there ain't no secret. 'Less you count fightin' the nastiest critters in Koprulu, of course.
Heh, well, I'd say years of trainin' to fight all the horrors Koprulu has to offer, but that ain't really a secret.
Eh, sometimes they're just 'cause I thought they looked cool... though others I got to celebrate certain victories or high points.
It varies, Brock; I got 'em after certain successful battles, good moments, or just because I liked 'em.
...Yeah, I have. Not sure if I could tell much you'd be interested in, though.
Well... yeah, sure. I probably wouldn't be the best guy to ask, though.
Well, faith ain't always easy to come by, unfortunately. Just hope you have more faith in yourself than I did.
Everybody's gotta believe in somethin', Laevatein. But the most important person to believe in what you're doing is yourself, even if it ain't easy.

condition.saying: but a commoner

case.state: Don't think they'd be excitin' tales, Miko, but they are some nice ones. Days of just helpin' my parents on the farm, drivin' the harvester and plantin' crop.

condition.saying: fried rice

case.state: Hm... hate to disappoint, lil' hellraiser, but I haven't really thought that far ahead. Mostly concerned with all I've currently got on my plate.
...Well, now that you mention it, I'm not sure. We're still busy helpin' the Dominion hold off against its new enemies, but I ain't really thought about what comes after.
...Bein' honest, I don't know. I've been focusin' so much lately on helpin' the Dominion defend from its new threat that I ain't thought about that at all.

condition.saying: anyone like me

case.state: Someone who dresses up in bright polka-dot spandex to fight crime? If I have, I don't expect to get that memory back.
Well, yeah; Koprulu's got quite the interestin' set of alien life in it. Some good, some bad... most of it with some capacity to tear your throat out if you piss it off.
Koprulu's got plenty of alien life, alright. And they're definitely the kind to make an impression real quickly - for better or worse.
Yeah, there's alien life all over Koprulu. On good days, you'll mostly just see the tamer fauna it's got. And on bad days... well, the Zerg.
Well, I suppose that depends, Jess' - you got any experience drivin' a stick-shift?
Maybe, maybe... but how smooth or rough do you like your rides, Jess'?
Drinkin' and talkin' with folks, mostly. Sometimes cards, sometimes tryin' to beat the high score in Lost Vikings. Sounds simple, I know, but it ain't bad.
Nothin' that special - drinkin' and talkin', sometimes a challenge at cards or Lost Vikings. It's all good, though.
Yeah, you're about spot-on. Feels like there's been war in the Koprulu sector longer than there's ever been peace.
Hate to say it, Nami, but you're right. The history of the Koprulu sector and its timeline of war are almost one and the same.
Heh, sorry, but I think you'd better look elsewhere, Miss Perona. That ain't the type of work I usually take.
Hate to break it to you, Miss Perona, but I ain't lookin' for work right now. 'Sides, moving man isn't really in my job field anyway.
Indeed I have, Miss Cynthia. We were a vagabond kinda outfit, meanin' there were always new planets we were goin' to.
Right you are, Miss Cynthia. Goin' from planet to planet was more or less the usual for us, since the Hyperion was the closest thing we had to a home.
Right you are, Lux. Looks like I could probably say the same about you... though clearly a much different kinda military.
Well, you're not wrong, Nami. But with the Zerg swarms and Protoss tribes to deal with as well, other humans definitely ain't the only things we're fightin'.
You're thinkin' of alien races, right, Nami? Yeah. Specifically, the Zerg and some Protoss tribes bring the most trouble. But there's plenty of humans just as nasty, too.
Hm... anything in particular been hard about it? I don't wanna press too hard, but...
Really... If you don't mind, what's been so hard about learnin' to do better?

condition.saying: moon's reflection

case.state: Hm... If we're talkin' comforting memories, I guess the closest I got is the days of my youth - just helpin' my parents on the farm.
Raynor. Jim Raynor. I take it you're from before the United Earth Directorate's time, if you don't know about the supercarrier crashes?
Heh, consider me flattered, Ms. Ziegler... even if "specimen" is a bit of an odd way of putting it.

condition.saying: Raynor's Raiders

case.state: You guessed right, pal. What can I do for ya?

condition.saying: ancient force

case.state: Well... from my understandin', he's the last living Xel'Naga, the progenitors of the galaxy. He's got it in his head that all life is inherently suffering, and wants to end it as some kinda twisted act of mercy.

condition.saying: odds of us meeting

case.state: Agreed. Actually... if our foes are as similar as they seem, we might be able to help each other learn how to better fight 'em.

condition.saying: mindless swarm

case.state: Just like the Zerg... experience has shown that if there's an opportunity to take out that individual, you oughta go for it. In fact, the psychic feedback is so great that it makes 'em start attackin' each other as well.

condition.saying: share his goals

case.state: Brutal as the Tal'Darim Protoss are, it ain't just his power. They think Amon'll make them gods of his new world... guess no one mentioned to them how he plans to wipe them out too.

condition.saying: swarms of Zerg

case.state: Same as always - deployin' just about anything that can hit several targets at once, and controlling any choke points we can find.

condition.saying: fighting style

case.state: Probably nothin' like what you're familiar with. My marines and I tend to focus on keepin' accuracy steady even while shooting full-auto; not really an issue with the bows you're probably used to.

condition.saying: back to base

case.state: Yeah, I'll probably just be lurkin' around a bit more before I head on back. Duty calls, after all.
I hail from the Koprulu Sector, Miss Fina. Most folks here probably haven't heard of it, considerin' it's near the edges of this galaxy.
Good point... actually, come to think of it, I guess we can both relate to fallin' for gals who died at one point... as well as comin' back with a vengeance.
Well, sure... pretty rocky and complicated experience, but experience nonetheless.
Well, uh... kind of a mixed bag, really. On the one hand, there's plenty of things that make it worth fightin' for... but fightin's just about all that's been happening lately.
Heh, yeah, pretty much. Still, I couldn't help holdin' out some hope I'd make it further than this.
Heh, and it's not every day I see a girl this blunt. Koprulu's pretty far from this planet, by the by - just around the edges of the Milky Way.
Well... there was an invasion force from Earth that happened to barge in a few years ago. Didn't exactly leave the best impression on folks here.
If you count an expeditionary force that declared war on just about everyone, terran and non-terran alike, then I guess so.
It's, uh... kinda both, Ms. Fina. We put down a powerful dictatorship not too long ago, and now we've been dealing with somethin' of a mad god.
That's because it ain't anywhere near Earth, man. It's a whole collection of star systems, way out on the edge of the galaxy.
Well... it ain't easy, for sure. It's one of the biggest responsabilities you can put on a man. But in the times when it matters most, it's also one of the most rewardin'.
Nothin' all that substantial, unfortunately - other than the odd game of cards or payin' a visit to the Lost Vikings arcade cabinet.
I'm afriad not, Meia - other than farmin' vehicles, the only thing I've really got much piloting experience with is hoverbikes.
Sorry to disappoint, Meia, but my piloting experience really just extends to hoverbikes - unless you count farmin' vehicles, that is.
I mean... I'd assume so, given how age always seems to affect everything else, Meia.
Well... given how many other things old age tends to change, I'd assume that that's the case, Meia.
"Sacred needles"? What, you think I got some kinda demon you need to exercise, Reimu?
Well, that's a new threat. You don't see some sort of unholy demon energy around me, do you, Reimu?
Well, of course, Ms. Petra. Can't be runnin' into battle without some sort of protection, can you?
Hell, why wouldn't we? I think just about any fight would call for some kinda protection, Ms. Petra.

condition.saying: With the beard

case.state: Sorry, uh, I don't think we've met, Ms...?
Well, I just needed some time off. Been so caught up with fightin' off threats lately that people were getting concerned. You?
Huh... You mean that as a compliment of sorts, Ms. Aran?
Really... that's a good thing, I hope?

condition.saying: human world

case.state: Really now? Well, I can't say I've met anyone with angel wings, unfortunately. I'd remember that pretty well - as I'm sure your friend does.
Depends on which one you're talkin' about - some of 'em do, others I just got 'cause they looked cool.
That's right, Miss Barbara. Not only that, but where I'm from, I'm pretty sure more people have been on a different planet at one point than not.
Correct, Miss Barbara. We're far past the point now where humanity's restrained on just a single planet - hell, most will travel to at least one more in their lifetime.
Huh. Wouldn't have expected you to be quite so invested in the Protoss and our... wait, what do you mean by fanart---?
Really... Is that a compliment, then?
When I was still a kid? Hell, I don't know if I even had any. All I was really concerned with back then was just helpin' my parents on their farm.
If you're talkin' about my time in the Confederacy Corps, I wasn't even in it for a year before I left. Lost my heart for killin' over profit pretty quickly.
I may not be close with all of 'em, but there's not a single one I ain't proud of. They have a better fightin' spirit than most, and real conviction in what we do.
Never gave it much thought. To be honest, I wasn't even sure if I'd survive this long, so thinkin' about that just seemed like a waste of time.
Thanks, Yusuke. To be honest, I didn't think they'd interest you much; just reckoned they fell short of your standards for 'high' art.
Thank me? For what?
Dunno, didn't have anything concrete in mind. I usually just like to go where the wind takes me.
Hey... You doin' alright there, Saki? You look like something's eatin' you up inside.
Well, I'm a soldier, Miss Tsumiki. Frankly, it'd be weirder if I haven't been hurt, now would it?
I mean, that kinda comes with the territory of bein' a soldier, don't it, Miss Tsumiki?
Maybe I do. Though my question is, who's askin'?
Just like to stay prepared, is all. Don't expect anything to happen here, but... I prefer it this way.
Well, that's a pretty long list you're askin' me to choose from, Heris... guess if I had to choose, I'd say the planet Shakuras.
Nah, it's all good, Miss Tsumiki. I'm more worried about spookin' you.
No need to apologize, Miss Tsumiki. Just don't wanna overwhelm you too much.
Heh, you usually that quick on the draw when it comes to flattery?
Heh, far from the first time someone's called me that, Ringo.
Well, you definitely ain't the first to give me that label, Ringo.
Advice on boys? You sure I'm the right guy to ask about that, Ringo?
Really, Ringo? Don't figure I'd be the obvious type to ask about boys, to be honest.
Heh, can't remember the last time someone complimented me on these. A white shirt and an old bandolier really ain't nothin' to write home about.
Just figured I needed a change of pace, Mari. Things have been stressful lately, so I thought swingin' by here could be a nice break from it all.
It's... complicated, Mari. Very complicated.
Right you are, Mari. Been a grunt, a lawman, a rebel, and a leader. Each time I've always been there on the front lines.
Heh, was just thinkin' the same thing, Mari. I've seen places with plenty of colorful types before, but this place is definitely somethin' else.
...Used to be, a while ago. Though somehow, it feels even longer than that.
...You'll need to back up a bit there, Beatrix. 'Fraid that all flew right over my head.
Well, I guess I shouldn't be one to criticize. There's a lot I can tell you, though I ain't sure where you'd want to start.
Alright, if you insist then. Don't know what exactly you'd be interested in, but I can tell you plenty.
What, it's too hard to believe I'm just here to unwind after a long day's work and meet some new faces, Blake?
Heh, thanks. Though if I wanted to blend in, I'd probably need somethin' more than just a t-shirt and jeans.
Well, once you've accepted that the woman you're talkin' to also's got wings, the rest just kinda falls into place.
Well, our armor tends to be the same size from person to person. Makes standardization a whole lot easier.
True that. It ain't somethin' we ever had a luxury in choice of, so often we had to go with scavenging as much as we could.

Well, whatever challenges that has for a regular kinda army, it's even worse for a rebel outfit like ours. Bein' labeled as terrorists and outlaws by the bastards you're fightin' sure ain't good for your image.
I leave it up to those who have been around the longest. They've seen and done plenty enough to make sure the greener faces are filled in and know how to fight 'em.
As well as we can manage. Ain't nothin' like a four-star hotel, but I'm not gonna make 'em sleep in the ship's halls or anything.
Arueshalae, I'm dense as hell when it comes to women - so believe me when I say you ain't no challenge to read.
I certainly hope so, Nico - lettin' the weight of the world get to me like that would just be the easy way out, if you ask me.
I'm glad to hear that, Nico - never liked the idea of lettin' myself fall into that kinda bitterness, so it's reassurin'.
Really now? What kinda groups were they, Nico?
You don't say, Nico? I'd be interested in hearin' about these groups.
Yeah, sounds about right, Brock. 'Course, the field's usually too nasty for the sixgun, 'less I've got a particularly personal target.
Heh, well, the sixgun's mostly just for personal stuff by this point. I got bigger hardware for the real threats.
Well, right now we're focusing on fightin' back this hybrid army bent on mass genocide. After that... well, I ain't really sure if I'll live that long to begin with.
Maybe... but if that's the case, then I'll leave it to any historians willin' to learn about it. I'm not gonna run from passin' on - don't wanna overstay my welcome, after all.
More recently, sure. Odd as it is, this ain't my first rodeo in a multi-dimensional hodgepodge.
From time to time, sure. It's a popular business where I'm from... actually, it's kinda odd to be in a place with folks who haven't dabbled in it for once.
Heh, years ago, it probably would've been... but by this point, I've seen so much psionics and magic that pullin' a rabbit out of a hat would be like watchin' a lawn getting mowed.
Well, I'm clear on the weapons part already... but where do people look like where you come from, then?
Times have just been rough lately, Miko... rougher than usual, I mean. I came here tonight so I could get away from it all for a bit, just unwind for once.
Hm? What'd that be, pray tell?
Well, I've been part of multiple outfits, one of which I formed and lead for quite a few years, so yeah - I'd say I've got some experience, Pit.

condition.saying: Hm... Did you go to a training school or something like that? Luna Nova's great for training witches, but I bet there's all kinds of other powers out there, huh?

case.state: If you're talkin' about the Confederacy Corps academy, then yeah. Don't recommend it to anyone, though. Not that it's still around.

condition.saying: It's easy to tell a hero when you see one. I've fought a few monsters, but most of them were actually pretty nice, y'know? They just need a union!

case.state: Kinda reminds me of the Protoss. Lots 'a folks find them pretty unnerving, but if you get on their good side, they're some of the best allies you can have.

condition.saying: ~Name~'s really nice! It's great that-- wait, you uh, don' tknow about... the whole world of secret magic and monsters, do you?

case.state: Well, I've been told that I know more about the Protoss than anyone else. That count for somethin'?

condition.saying: ~Name~'s hair looks kinda like Professor Ursula's! I'm hoping you'll be as inspiring!

case.state: Heh, well, you don't get to lead a revolution with just black hair and some harsh words, Miss Kagari.
Well, it was bound to happen eventually. Might as well be now.
