Honestly, it's almost a relief by this point. Suspense was startin' to kill me.
Hey, it's all about luck, after all. Guess mine just ran out for now.
Don't count me out just yet - this thing's just getting started.
Heh, savor it, kids, 'cause this is the last time it's gonna happen tonight.
Well, chalk one up for all 'a you. But don't get settled in just yet.
All right, all right - I'll do it, don'tcha worry now.
Well, you should never get too big for your britches, after all.
I've had plenty of time to learn to never get used to bein' on top... for better and worse.
Don't start thinkin' you've shattered my morale now; I'm still fightin' like a pissed-off Hydralisk.
Mm... Alright, no sweat. I'm still in this.
Okay; that wasn't good, but it's far from over.
Lost the battle for now, but... well, you know.
Still in it - I ain't ready to ride off in the sunset just yet.
Damn... well, easy come, easy go.
Can't win 'em all, I guess.
Dammit... feels like I just charged in only to face a line of Photon Cannons.
Oh boy... I knew what I was gettin' into, but that won't make this any less awkward.
Hm... hope this ain't gonna be a trend or anything.
Alright, alright. I can deal with this.
Alright, fine. Still got plenty 'a time.
Hm... startin' to wish credits really were on the line.
Usually I've got a special card to play... but not this time.
I swear, hands like this sting worse than a faceful of Baneling acid.
Just so we're clear, nobody swapped mine, right? Been cheated before, plenty of times.
Yeah, not quite the outcome I was hopin' for.
Well, that's how it goes, I guess.
Was hopin' that hand would be worth something'. Guess I was hoping against hope.
Damn... if only I'd kept that one card...
Well, there goes that plan.
Man, really thought I could've worked something out there.
Well then... I expect the fat lady to start singin' any moment.
Aw, hell...
Yyyyyeah... this is goin' bust real bad.
I'm not the type to beg for mercy, but... if ya have any to give...?
Alright, alright - I'm a big boy, I can take my licks.
Dammit, dealer, you're really puttin' me six feet under here!
Hell with it... if I've fallen this far, I might as well go a bit further.
You just couldn't catch a break for me, could you, dealer?
Tonight's had all sorts 'a turns and twists... and this is my least favorite so far.
Hm... guess years of leadin' troops still don't help much with card strategy.
My old man taught me this game... so why am I losin' so bad?
All of a sudden, I don't feel like I've had enough to drink.
I'm not sure I like what the hell's going on here...
You sure we can't bring folding into this ruleset?
Dammit, it's already embarassing enough to get the short end in regular Poker.
I've had bad luck in cards before... but it never felt quite as uncomfortable as it does here.
Won't lie... this kinda stings.
Yeah, that's my usual luck again.
Alright, y'all have clearly been doing this a lot more than me lately.
Damn... am I really that outta practice?
Alright... not the best first sign.
Well, I'm glad we can agree on that, at least.

condition.saying: so far divorced

case.state: Good for you. You're the only one who would be.

condition.saying: in awe at myself

case.state: Yeah, plenty 'a killers and megalomaniacs would say the same. You ain't special, kid.
Really now? Hm... well, if she does show up, I'm guessin' she wouldn't be too easy for me to miss, would she?
Sounds about right to me. I'd also toss in practicing at the firin' range, but... well, I doubt firearms are that common where you're from.
Yeah... Skinny there ain't exactly the toughest brick in the mortar pit, is he?
Well, that ain't a fair comparison, is it? Hell, my braniac pal Stetmann's more rugged than him.
Yep; whole lotta acres' worth, too. Most simple and honest work I ever done.
Well, it may not've been the casual "roses and sunflowers" kind, but there were all kinds 'a crops I planted and gathered.
'Course I did - livestock's only half the part, after all.

condition.saying: in awe at myself

case.state: I think we all fancy the idea of bein' more powerful when we're young, right? Still... it ain't all it's cracked up to be sometimes.

condition.saying: so far divorced

case.state: ...You really know how to give a guy the creeps, don't you, kid?
Wouldn't say I'm repulsed by the life I've lead at all, but... "regret" certainly describes some parts.
You said it. It's only just hittin' me how long it's been since I was last somewhere that wasn't some battlefield or the Hyperion.
{small}About as far away as I could've ever hoped for, pretty much. I don't think I've even been outside Koprulu before... besides the Nexus, that is.{!reset}
True, but it might also be a bit more relaxing to have a familiar face here... 'long as this doesn't make things awkward when you get back.
True, but it might also be a bit more relaxing to have some familiar faces here. I'm sure they won't tell if you don't.
Yep.
Mm-hm.
Well no, it ain't like we have 'em in Koprulu or anything... but I've been to other places in my time, including mishmash ones like this.

condition.saying: kinda scare me

case.state: Hm? What, so big guys like me ain't allowed to hang here too?
I mean... in a way. We took 'em down, so now it falls to us to rebuild and reform their whole system. Can't really say we're separate from 'em now.
{small}Hell, where do I even start? The Zerg, the Tal'Darim, nearly every pirate and bounty hunter that ever held a gun... and of course the ol' Dominion. Pick your poison.{!reset}
"Homeworld"? You mean to tell me that there's a whole Terran planet that only has women?
Well, I certainly don't think he would... but Mira probably would, unfortunately.
Don't get too discouraged, now. If you're really wantin' a kid, I'm sure there's plenty of donor banks in your sector, right?
Hm... beats the hell outta me. Most often I feel like the same farmboy outta his depth that I was 15 years ago.
{small}Well... truth be told, it's never easy. But you can at least be glad you knew 'em for the time you had, and they went out for a good cause...{!reset}
Yeah. I got it, alright. Didn't get the final shot, but it was worth seein' him get what he had comin'.
Yeah. Wasn't only my revenge, but I think it's better that way anyhow.
Oh yeah, there's intelligent life, all right. The Protoss are the most notable ones - hell, "intelligent" is an understatement with them.
{small}Well, for the most part we'd been workin' to take down the Dominion - or more accurately, its psychotic dictator. One of the most evil men there ever was.{!reset}
{small}There's a lot we've been fightin', but our main cause was takin' down the Dominion dictator, Mengsk. Held way too many people in a grip of iron and spikes.{!reset}
{small}Our main purpose was freein' humanity from the Dominion dictatorship... though we also had to scrap with the Zerg quite a bit as well.{!reset}
{small}The Dominion was our main target; nastiest kind of regime you can picture. Though we also had to step in between some Zerg attacks too.{!reset}
{small}Latter's more like it. They can guard their more discreet thoughts, sure, but otherwise they can sense everythin' right down to what they're feelin'.{!reset}
Yeah, telepathy. And they've mastered it so much that they can even use it to talk with other life like us, without even needin' mouths.
Any reason for it? I'm willin' to bet it ain't for any degrees of selflesness or what have you.
Well, he must have an interestin' reason for it, if he's usually the type of mob boss you're used to.
So what's his stake in it? Like you said, mob bosses don't typically do the fightin' themselves.
Well, that's where the Nerazim come in - the Dark Templar. They wanted nothin' to do with it, so they severed their nerve cords, cuttin' off their connection to the Khala.
Yeah, not all of 'em were happy. The Nerazim hated it so much that they cut off the nerve cords connecting 'em to the Khala, and became the Dark Temlplar.
Well, I sure wouldn't have figured you'd have trouble with it. You seem like the kinda gal who could have just about any friends you'd like.
The former, really. My boys and I were trapped on a hostile planet along with them years ago, and we realized workin' together was for the best. Guess we kinda grew to like each other after that.

Unusual circumstances - some years ago, we all ended up trapped on a Zerg-infested planet together, and... well, we realized we had more to gain from workin' together than fightin'. Thankfully, we'd still realized that after we escaped.
Must be quite the den of trouble, then - wouldn't be my first visit to a place where that's a common business.
Sometimes, but it's advanced enough that they can set up in a matter of seconds if need be. 'Sides, our flame troops like firebats and hellions can make quick work of whole clusters as well.
Smash realms? I assume that ain't an average kinda place where you're from, if it's the only one you've gotten to handle guns in...
Heh, you flatter me. Nothin' like years of good farmwork to build good muscle as strong as a good work ethic.
Guess that makes sense, considerin' where you're from and all. Where I'm from, space travel's way more practical than it was in the days of old.
Suppose I can understand that. It's different in Koprulu; it ain't the cheapest thing, sure, but it's more affordable than I know it used to be.
Nah, I ain't much of a wine guy. The smell and taste is always too sweet for me.
Maybe they are, but the Vulture's got an old style to it you just can't beat. "Old and busted" is just a bunch of techno-chauvenism.
Well... I mean, yeah, but-
Nexus...? You know about the--- oh, you're talkin' about here. Nevermind.
Aim stabalizers are always a must, especially with other gun mods. As for armor, kinetic foam's a real lifesaver, if you know someone who can fit it with CMCs.
...Riiiiight.
...Okay, how the hell do they know that name? Who's even watchin' this?
Look, did we wage war? Yes. Did we get civillians in the crossfire or brainwash conscripts, like the Dominion? No. That enough for you?
...I'll give you a pass in case I didn't hear that right, but on the off chance I did: Hell no.
Heh, that's quite the mental image you landed on. I've definitely put these muscles to the test plenty of times... never popped anyone's head, though.
Thanks... Uh, that ain't a request, is it? Even if you'd be fine, I'm still gettin' used to you poppin' it off yourself.

It's like this - a warp drive is an engine powerful enough to open up the barrier into warp space for a fraction of a second, and then open it back up when exiting. The drive simply pulls the rest of the ship with it.
Most recent one's the latter category, unfortunately. Put simply, we're fightin' for our survival against the whims of a mad god bent on destroyin' all life.
Yeah... though, if any of them showed up, wouldn't that kinda put both of you in the same boat?
Sorry, forgot about the whole "different worlds" nature of this place for a moment... I am thirty-four, though; nothin' incorrect there.
Well, I promise you I ain't some crazy TV gangster type, boss. If I was, I don't think they'd have let me in with my gun in the first place.
Huh. Well, if it's just a general question, then I'd be willing to answer.
Thanks. I'd like to hope the same - even if I can't help but wonder if that chance has already passed me by.
Some ages make it easier than others, sure, but if you ask me, there ain't no time to not be at your peak.
...Well, I mean, you can still do it if you want. Not gonna force you to look or anything.
Yeah... maybe I should try not to think about it too much.
Vegan? That really true, Anatoly?
Well, I respect how upfront you are with it, Anatoly. Don't worry - be my guest.
Actually, we finally succeeded not long ago. I even got to live to see it happen, much to my surprise.
Well, believe it or not, we actually won recently. Almost can't believe I finally get to say that.
Most likely, yeah. The alien threats we face always seem to come bigger and nastier over time, so we gotta make sure our weapons do too.
Sure, it probably wouldn't be long before the pirates and criminals could get ahold of 'em. But I say it's an alright price to pay for standin' a better chance in the sector.
Damn right. Weapons like that are a part of history - even if they don't stand up to bigger, flashier stuff, they've got their own important place.
Right on, Noire. All of 'em are works of art in their own way - and snubbin' them just 'cause they ain't the latest hardware is just plain disrespectful.
Surprised? I know it ain't the most "tactical" choice, but sometimes you gotta go with what your heart tells you.
That's the spirit, Noire. 'Long as you ain't handicapping yourself, you gotta go with what you know and love. Who's gonna tell you no, anyway?
'Course I did. If I ain't willing to stick my neck out there for what we're fightin' for, then why should any of my boys?
Pretty much any victory that involved savin' lives. Too many civillians get caught in the crossfire of wars like these, and it feels good knowin' we can protect them.
Hell, just about any victory where we could keep innocent lives safe. Someone's gotta stick up for them, after all - might as well be us.
Sure did. Can't keep a guy like me away from supportin' his brothers and sisters on the field - nor should you. We're all in it together.

condition.saying: give it up for free

case.state: Hm... quite the offer you're makin' there, Dorothy. Tryin' to get me paranoid about losin' money on a deal?

condition.saying: well-oiled machine

case.state: Sigh... And you just had to choose the kinda wordplay I like, too...
I mean, I get that. But doin' it with a bot is quite the darin' step forward - especially one that looks a bit on the younger side.

condition.saying: boring about sex

case.state: Touch. I suppose... I've always liked startin' slow. Taking time to really feel every inch of each other while connected is just... a feelin' I've really missed.

condition.saying: sense of justice

case.state: ...Well, damn. And here I was wonderin' whether or not I've still "got it" when I came here.
Florence, eh? Well, it's quite a pleasure to meet ya.
{small}It ain't always nice, but it usually doesn't end another way. Some kid with a gun thinkin' he's invincible may be stupid, but he's also dangerous.{!reset}
Well, partner, if you're ever interested in some work outside of Earth, I'm sure Graven would have some nice, high-payin' jobs for ya.
Hm... you certainly remind me of the sort Graven usually works with. Ever thought of makin' a fortune off-Earth?

condition.saying: Komi-san doesn't get the feeling that Raynor's a bad person, necessarily. But playing strip poker versus a large, grizzled man who's old enough to be her father is making her extra jittery.

case.state: You doin' okay? I get you ain't one for much chitchat, but you look...
Yep. Now that ol' Mengsk's gone... well, I don't know for sure how things'll go, but they'll definitely be better.
Yeah... we've still got a ways to go, but I'm hopin' things will look up for everyone real soon.

condition.saying: It's really truly probably nothing at all!

case.state: Okay, then... actually, you're lookin' kinda pale. Everything alright?

condition.saying: I guess it goes to show that even men who look like badasses can still be super nice!

case.state: {small}Heh, appearances are a fickle thing, ain't they? I've seen plenty of scary lookin' folk who turned out to be the tightest pals you'd hope for.{!reset}
Well, even the biggest of our boys and girls don't ride into battle with no armor. And a combat shield, if we can afford it.
Sure, but that's what we got armor for. A good CMC suit's always the best defense... that and and a rugged ol' C-14.
Really now... bands of pirates or raiders, I take it?
Well, it ain't everyday a guy like me gets to meet a wizard, is it? 'Cept for the Nexus, but that's another story.

condition.saying: Ahahah! Okay, that's a good one.

case.state: {small}Think about it - you play up the zombie role so damn good that he's convinced it's all gone horribly wrong, and y'all keep yourselves from laughin' just long enough to hear him squealin'!{!reset}
Same to you, pal. You can call me Jim, Jimmy, Raynor - whatever floats your boat.
Don't worry, I definitely didn't come with actually usin' it in mind. But... well, even more than that, it's a sentimental kinda thing as well.

condition.saying: free will

case.state: The hybrids? Yeah, even if they're as bent to Amon's will as any of their flunkies. Feels good to see some real fear in their eyes before we snuff 'em out for good.
You think the Tal'Darim can still be convinced? They've been worshippin' this guy for even longer than terrans have been in Koprulu, you know.

condition.saying: staying around

case.state: ...Hm? You tryin' to put the moves on me now, Lucy? I mean, it's a pretty opportune time, considerin'...
Heh, exactly. In certain parts of Koprulu, I find that the most interestin' folks tend to have at least a few of 'em.
...Wasn't good. Wasn't honest. I tried to help folks as much as possible, but there wasn't much room for that in the kinda gang I was in. Hurt far too many to live with myself.
Well, it kinda goes like this; Fell in love with a women who... ended up dyin' and coming back as this sort of murder-crazy alien hybrid before I finally wiped the corruption from her.
Hm... that is a temptin' offer, to be honest. Tryin' to find some romantic spark again was honestly one of my other reasons for coming here.
Really... So you came to a place as 'social' as this even though you ain't the best at speakin' to people?
Well, that's a pretty good reason. Never hurts to be more comfy around folks, regardless of what you do.
Not a bad idea. Bit of an unexpected way of doin' it, but getting better at talkin' to folks is always a good idea.
Oh, right, not everyone here knows about... well, I guess picture a crossbow, 'cept the ammo's a lot smaller, faster, and reloading ain't nearly as slow
Oh, yeah, you're one of those high-fantasy types... you've got crossbows where you're from, right? It's like that, 'cept way faster and smaller.
Yeah? Mind showin' me that warrant?
Yeah? You gonna be the one to try snatchin' it when I'm not looking, Scuttlebutt?
...Well, yeah, you don't want to mess around with that kinda stuff when you're on the job. But it's still better than bringin' the stench of death with you.
Really now... so even a rough, hardened killer like you get still get flustered, eh?
Then they oughta get their hunting licenses revoked, pronto. That kinda irrisponsibility has no place in that sort of business.
Guess so. I sure hope that ain't my only silver linin', though.
Huh. So you're tryin' to make me feel better? Guess I can appreciate that, weird as it is.

Not really sure... Most I know is that the supercarriers that transported our ancestors from Earth to Koprulu got lost in warp space for 28 years before they shut down, so it's definitely right on the edge of the Milky Way.
Not a far-off comparison, really. 'Cept locusts are easier to kill, and don't have nearly as many terrible forms.
Well, they're very traditional and fierce... but they're also honest and honorable. Guess that's part of why we've grown to like each other so much, thinkin' about it.
Guess not. Sometimes I wonder if humanity's just doomed to keep fightin' forever... but what little optimism's still left in me hopes it ain't so.
Well, who knows? If I'm lucky, one of those people might just be around here tonight...
I see. Guess I can't judge you for that - 'specially considering most nasty sorts you find in Koprulu tend to be trigger-happy too.
Hm. Well, I'm no stranger to how much harm they can cause in devilish hands either, so I ain't about to criticize.
Sure is. Not all towns are like that, but most of 'em are full of folks who know each other by name, and make each other feel right at home.
Not all places on it, but a good portion of them are. Everyone gets known in their community somehow, and they make sure it's for good reasons.
Well, I woudn't call myself a serious poker player or the like, boss. Hell, the strip poker scene's actually pretty new to me still.
Professional? Heh, if there's an upper-class profession out there that just requires a plain t-shirt and jeans, I'd sure like to know it.
I've seen plenty of girls not far from your age manage it. 'Sides, it could even give you a whole new kinda look, right?
Thinkin' about getting bulked up now? Honestly, if you managed it, I'd be willin' to buy you the first new dress you need.
'Round the Koprulu sector, I think lots of folks are tough in different ways. It pays to be, given how dangerous it can be...
Don't think it's the kind of history anyone you know'd be familiar with. And frankly, I hope it stays that way.
That's good to hear. Funny... never really thought much about how Earth looks. I only know it's so different from region to region.
Well, not the strippin' type. Actually, I'm still relatively new to it here.
In all seriousness, I hope this doesn't feel too much like a punishment. Don't wanna start makin' you feel uncomfortable.
Heh, wouldn't be the first time... though I'm hopin' he wouldn't give me a reason to.
Sigh... If you're gonna have a twisted sense of humor, Dorothy, I'd at least appreciate a warnin'.
I've faced down all kinds of Zerg in my time, and some of the angrier Protoss, too. Then there's the more... "metaphorical" monsters, you could say. Real bad people out there doin' real bad things.
Oh, it ain't in a sea, Nami; it's much further than that. It ain't even on Earth - you'd have to go on the fringes of this galaxy to find it.
Hm... think that's part of the trouble? No aliens to go to war with, so your folk gotta settle with each other?
Hm... maybe that's why things spiraled out. If you're lookin' to make trouble but don't have another species to hate, maybe you just make it up yourself.
Yeah, that's certainly for the better... but then again, we've also learned a lot from alien life as well.
Can't say I blame you, with all the fightin' we've faced. Still... we kinda have them to thank for a lot of breakthroughs as well.

condition.saying: human settlement

case.state: Kinda makes me wonder how it'd play out if you did suddenly discover alien life one day. You think your folk would be prepared?
Yeah, that's kinda how it was in Koprulu before the Zerg and Protoss... actually, how'd you think things would play out if your sector found alien life one day?
Starcraft? Blizzard Enter... Why's all that sound familiar?
Well, uh... it's kinda like this: You know how you and everyone you know lives on a planet, right in the middle of space?
Huh, wasn't expecting you to offer aid so quickly. Helpin' people must come pretty naturally to you, does it?
"Cattle"... more like criminals. To them, we're just a bunch of nations of thieves and crooks, the same way they viewed our ancestors who got sent to Koprulu.
Not easily, that's for sure. Nearly every Terran force in the sector is bucklin' down to defend right now, and we've had to leave it to some "other" friends to take the offensive.
Yeah, I know. I've just spent so much time thinkin' about that stuff lately that I figured I didn't have enough time for anything else.
No kiddin', Fina? You, a friend of pirates? And here I'd figured you were one of those "high-civilized" sorts...

condition.saying: I look quite young for my age, don't I? I don't look a day over 25, but I have the horniness of a 15 year old.

case.state: Sounds like you sure know how to have a fun night, Jess. You come to a lot of games like this?
Heh, you're definitely quite the looker, Jess. Kinda feel bad I didn't tidy up before comin' here.

condition.saying: If you think I already look young outside, wait 'till you see what I have under the hood. Quite unbelievable, I have to tell you.

case.state: Well then... guess I'll have to start playin' better if I want to see it, don't I?

condition.saying: So many have tried getting the prize, but so few have succeeded. The reward is all worth it, though.

case.state: High stakes, high reward... just what I'm used to anyway.

condition.saying: I suppose that true. But not everyone will get the prize by the end of the night. Only the winner would.

case.state: Not gonna make it easy, then? Guess that's fair. Easy ain't my thing neither.

condition.saying: Oh, I get what you mean. Lucky for you, I am quite the expert in helping men like you relieve their tension. I've been doing my part for more than two decades now.

case.state: Heh, well, you might have your work cut out for you, Jess. Feels like I've got a whole hive of tension in my head sometimes.

condition.saying: I can take care of your stress if you're interested. I have perfected the massage technique that would help ease your tension. I've only been doing it for the better part of two decades after all.

case.state: Damn, don't tempt me with somethin' too good to be true. Feels like half my muscles are held up just by stress alone sometimes.

condition.saying: Yeah, you are pretty huge. I'm fairly sure the tallest person I know only reaches to your chin!

case.state: If that's as tall as you've seen, Nep, I can't help but wonder how your shortest friend looks.
{small}Well, between leadin' a revolution, helpin' an empire reform itself, and fightin' a whole array of nasties, I ain't exactly had much free time on my hands lately.{!reset}
{small}Well, there's leadin' a rebel group, helpin' people rebuild their homes, and fightin' off a whole lot of nasty varmints. "Busy" feels like an understatement, really.{!reset}

condition.saying: Sooo~ what do you do. Professionally, I mean?

case.state: {small}Well, there's a whole lot I've done over the years; usually involvin' fightin' and shootin' of some sort. Guess lately it's been that mixed with more civil stuff.{!reset}

condition.saying: Well... guns are cool. Plus, I'm pretty good at the cocking motion.

case.state: Heh, well, single-actions are kinda hard to find nowadays, but I think our quartermaster's got a few you'd like.

condition.saying: And by myself, I mean--

case.state: Hey, look, I'm sure what we've got is just failure to communicate here, and... well, forgive me for what I'm about to say, but it sounds like-

condition.saying: I just want you to know I actually can't have daddy issues.

case.state: What's that supposed to mean? Unless... oh. He's passed on?

condition.saying: Aww, indulge me a little, Daddy.

case.state: ...I'm sorry, did I hear that right?
Seems to me like it should be the bare minimum. Leadin' with fear's exactly what we were fightin' against.
Ask me, anyone who leads with fear is no leader at all. It's exactly what we were tryin' to prove to everyone.
Better than most would. He's deadset on bein' better than Arcturus was, and I'd say he's doin' well at that so far.
Doin' well, actually. He's found a way to channel all that resentment into bein' a good leader, and a good man too.
You don't need to tell me 'bout that, Miss Cynthia. I've seen it happen myself - specifically with the Dominion.
Trust me, Miss Cynthia, I know. Hell, why do you think we were fightin' the Dominion to begin with?
Sounds like a good basis to me. I've had enough first-hand experience to know that a life of violence only pays in tragedy.
Well, you've got my encouragement with that. Not enough folk realize that dyin' by the sword's the only end to livin' by it.
Jeez... that's a recipe ripe for despots and tyrants right there. Fightin' ain't the only way to move forward, and it shouldn't be the first.
Damned shame, that is. The best folk out there are the ones who advance by helpin' each other.
It ain't personal. But gettin' extensive knowledge about that would take the "lucky in love" type, and I'm... well, the opposite of that.
...Let's just say that if you wanna hear an ideal love story, I think you'd have better luck askin' most other guys.
Well, if you wanna know about the power of love and how endurin' it is... I think I'm one of the last guys you should ask.
Well, hard as it is to separate the horrors... kinda nice, actually. Plenty of beautiful planets, interestin' folk... and plenty of ways to earn a livin'.

condition.saying: other planet

case.state: Bigger than that, hoss; it's a whole sector of systems. And each of those systems is a whole group of planets. Apparently it's right on the edge of what old Earth called the "Milky Way".

condition.saying: seem pretty chill

case.state: Hey, can't be on edge all the time, right? 'Sides, I've found that keepin' your cool after the fact helps you keep your cool during it too.

condition.saying: left arm

case.state: Memento of Operation Snake's Blade - one of the skirmishes we undertook to save a colony bein' attacked by the Zerg after the Dominion abandoned them.
The Battle of Dragon's Ridge - a raid we made on a Dominion mining base that was workin' its people into the ground... in some cases literally.

condition.saying: worry about

case.state: ...Rocketman, right now I ain't sure whether to laugh and clap you on the back or grimace and smack you upside the head.
Mm... I may've been an only child, but even I know that a sister like her is worth the world.
Well, that's always the hardest part - not knowin' if what you're tryin' is working or not. Believe me, I've had too many moments like that.
Yeah... the hardest choices are always the ones you ain't sure of. Hell, I lost track of the times I second-guessed myself a long time ago.
Hmph, I'd certainly believe it. Been fightin' for so long that I've almost forgotten what not bein' at war feels like.
Yeah, hate to say I can't really deny that. I got freedom for the people and revenge for myself, but... I'm only now realizin' I didn't plan much beyond that.
Long ways away, Nami - we're talkin' millions of lightyears here. From my understandin', it's on the edge of what folks here call the "Milky Way".
You said it, Nep. Ask me, not enough people appreciate that. Hell, I'd be dead many times over without mine.
Damn straight, Nep. Anyone who'd disagree clearly's never known the kinda people who'd lay their lives down for you.
Well then... that'd be one of the stranger offers I've recieved. Most folks don't substitute home cookin' with actual pay.
Huh... you must be pretty hard-pressed to get it moved. Just how good is your cookin', anyway?
Hey, calm down there. They can be killed, alright... it just ain't anything as easy as water.
I mean, they're far from invincible... but bein' weak to bullets isn't much of a weakness.
I ain't just talkin' about a planet - Koprulu's a whole sector of star systems. Is that so hard to believe when you're already a ghost, Ms. Casper?
Oh, they consider us human, alright... human enough that they just wanna conquer us rather than outright wipe us out. Like it's some kinda mercy to be proud of.
Well, guess we're still human enough that they wanna bring us into their big ol' empire... whether we like it or not.
I know what you mean. The ones we fought off were just an expeditionary fleet, and they still came close to winning.
They're terrifyin' to think about, for sure. The Dominion outnumbered their expedition forces even back then, and they still lost.
Just ain't the sort of thing I've thought about or looked into much. 'Sides, it's not like I know if I'll even live that long anyway.
Maybe a few others do, but I don't really think too much about it. Especially since it might never even be a concern for me at all.
Where I'm from, the year is 2506... that probably sounds pretty far-fetched too, right?
Try the weight of the galaxy. The victories feel as sweet as anything out there, but the losses... well, they stick with you.
You said it. I'd heard this place was unlike any other, but I had no idea how right that was... Heh, was that a psychic sparrow by any chance?
Well, I can't really blame you for findin' it hard. I don't think anyone'd find it easy under those circumstances.
Mm... Considerin' how long all that's been with you, I can see why it'd be hard. Givin' up everything you know like that ain't a small task.
'Course it did. A world where most folks are kept under a bootheel to the whims of some megalomaniac in a throne ain't a world worth livin' in.
Sure did. Someone had to look out for 'em and make sure they wouldn't be forgotten. Figured it might as well be me.
Oh. Well, I promise you that I didn't come here to start any trouble, Saki.
I am, yeah. Though I ain't from this star system to begin with, so it's not a shock you don't know about the war goin' on.
Right you are. The war isn't somethin' you would've heard of, though - it ain't even in this part of the galaxy.
There ain't no other planet that looks like it. Hell, I'm not even sure if I can accurately describe it - like a paradise under eternal twilight.
That's good. I can still give you the rundown on things, 'long as you promise you won't faint on me.
Glad to hear it. Just promise me you can handle it, and I'll try to be a bit more slow in explainin' it all.
Probably a lot of truth to that. Once you're in the deep end, you've got more reason to start learnin' than ever before.
Good point. If you're gonna start learnin', forgetting what's familiar for a bit can leave you with a lot more room for it.
Bad run-ins with 'em, I take it?
I've done my best in that department, for sure. Just hope I've earned it as much as they'd like to believe.
I've certainly done my damnest to inspire my boys and girls. It's up to them whether or not I live up to that, though.
Sounds like they were quite the dedicated bunch of folks, then. I just hope they were throwin' behind themselves a cause that's worth it.
The way you describe 'em, it sounds like they had the core of what any rebel group should have. Question is, was the cause itself worth it?
Just feels better to have. You didn't bring all your trinkets there 'cause you're planning to use 'em, right?
Just a comfort thing. I trust you didn't come here for trouble with your tools, and you can trust I didn't either.

condition.saying: It's not the same for me. Scars and wear don't affect me in the same way... being stone...

case.state: Stone? For real? Thought my eyes were trickin' me earlier...

condition.saying: I was having thoughts... What exactly is it you do? You don't seem much like the rest of these people.

case.state: {small}Well... for the past several years, I lead a revolution of sorts against this kill-crazy tyrant - real megalomaniac who had near every Terran world in his grip.{!reset}

condition.saying: I had a small hope that by this point you'd be taking of something of worth... Much of the challenge I supposed from you seems to be tedium.

case.state: Well, I may try to be courteous, but I ain't ever been one to go down without a fight.

condition.saying: Oh! I think it's a smart strategy... it's just not as cute as when girls do it.

case.state: Well, hopefully it won't be necessary anyhow - if I needed tons more to spare, I probably ain't that good at cards to begin with.
Heh, considering the girls decked out in gear I've seen, I can't help but agree, little miss.

condition.saying: I just think I prefer men a little softer. But you're still a cool shooter protagonist--

case.state: Huh... first time anyone's described me like that. But I won't tell you you're wrong or anything.

condition.saying: Appearances matter a lot, don't they? If you can make someone lose their morale before you start shooting, you already won, right?

case.state: {small}Very sage, little miss - we didn't get that luxury often, bein' smaller than the Dominion Corps and all, but it was always nice when killin' could be avoided.{!reset}

condition.saying: Oooooo-- don't be bashful now! C'mon! Spill!

case.state: {small}Well... alright, maybe I did come here hopin' to see some pretty dame who could help me take my mind off things. With dreads, if I'm lucky.{!reset}

condition.saying: Whoa! We don't usually see a ton of guys like you that play here, Jim!

case.state: Really? Didn't know if I'd stand out tonight... all the more reason for me to make a good impression, then.

condition.saying: So... that's a real gun, huh? I could talk a lot about magic but... what kind of gun are you using? Do you ever fight monsters?

case.state: Well, this here's a .42 wheelgun - a real antique kinda weapon. Don't use it much against the Zerg, though - I leave that to my C-14 more often.

condition.saying: Hm... do they make magic guns...? I bet someone does. I should ask a friend who works with magic items...

case.state: Now that could certainly be a boon. Hell, I'm surprised no one's tried combinin' Protoss psi-tech with our hardware before.
Well, sounds like an opportunity I can't ignore... I bet Swann would love to work with this friend of yours.

condition.saying: So... Jim, do you have tattoos everywhere...? Oh um, I mean... what are those tattoos on your arms for?

case.state: Reminders of past victories, mostly. The Battle of Dragon Ridge, Operation Snake's Blade, and other fun stuff like that.

condition.saying: Not that your socks aren't interesting and all, but what's that thing you're keeping in your sleeve? A good luck charm? Is that your magic?

case.state: 'Fraid it's nothing that interesting. Just a regular ol' pack of smokes.
...You certainly look like you've been waitin' for this part, Miss Kagari.
'Least with sea monsters, you can stay out of the water... 'Course, the Zerg can't swim, but them bein' in space is way worse.

{small}Battle of Dragon Ridge, for instance - that was a raid on a Dominion mining operation carried out by some of my best Viking pilots. Real dicey situation, since so many workers there were practically slave labor.{!reset}
{small}Longest one I've had is the one on my back - got it years ago soon after my Confed squad's first real mission. It's how we got the name "Heaven's Devils".{!reset}

{small}One of 'em was Operation Snake's Blade - we were rescuin' a colony that the Dominion had just left to die when the Zerg started comin' for 'em. We dug in pretty good, but so did the Zerg.{!reset}

condition.saying: You seem to be one of those Salt of the Earth types, Sir Raynor. Just the sort of subject a Crown Prince would do well to familiarize herself with.

case.state: You're certainly makin' a better first impression than the last prince I met. Though... ain't Prince a title for royal boys?

condition.saying: This Mengsk sounds like one of the vile warlords who ruled my country of Japan before the land was united under my Seventeen Article Constitution.

case.state: {small}It's a universal truth, sadly - anywhere there's people, there's bad men among 'em. Good news is he got the ending he deserved; right now we're just tryin' to help his Dominion rebuild.{!reset}

condition.saying: Ya look like the grizzled, veteran bikers we used to see ridin around. No offense. But you must have some dope stories!

case.state: {small}Well, I ain't one to brag, but I'm willin' to bet not too many of those bikers had stories of patrollin' in warzones. 'Course, maybe that's why they're as old as they are.{!reset}

condition.saying: Raynors Raiders? Im guess by that there bandolier, youre about moren just community service.

case.state: {small}Well, that depends on your definition. I'd say makin' the life of Arcturus Mengsk a livin' hell and rescuin' the folk he throws to the Zerg is servin' the community quite nicely.{!reset}

condition.saying: You got some sick tats, Jimbo. Do any of em got a story?

case.state: Good number of 'em do, Saki - though a few are just there 'cause I thought they looked good.

condition.saying: Yeah, it's good to keep in shape. Thankfully I don't really need to worry about that though.

case.state: You are lookin' pretty lean, Nep. Got some kinda diet plan or somethin' of the like?

condition.saying: Before they made Duel Disks, Kaibacorp was one of the worlds biggest dealers of military hardware. Everything from tanks, submarines, and long-distance rockets. Until Seto Kaiba took control of the company out from under his own father.

case.state: Damn... if he just usurped his own daddy like that, I'm worried to ask how the company's like under his own reign...

condition.saying: Duel Monsters to me is a way of life. But you're free to use it for whatever reason you want. Just duel the pain away.

case.state: Huh... sounds like this game's pretty important to you. Probably a far better copin' mechanism than mine, at least.

condition.saying: Of course, I doubt the weapons you use are anything vs a bunch of monster spirits. A tank is nothing compared to a Machina Fortress. It's like a tank, only is has an upper torso.

case.state: "Machina fortress"? Sounds like whoever made that was real impressed with their handiwork...

condition.saying: The last military man I met was like that. Professor Viper met a young boy while on duty. The boy saved his life, and Viper adopted him. That boy is dead now, they got very sick.

case.state: Oh... shit, that's rough...

condition.saying: So you fight real, honest to goodness aliens? So what? I fought a demon army once! <i>I got captured and sacrificed by a demon in dreadlocks, but we don't talk about that.

case.state: Yeah, sorry kid, but you'll have to do more to impress me if your only real contribution was gettin' captured.

condition.saying: They would like to, but it's an unexplored, untested, and unknown industry. They could waste billions and have nothing to show for it, or destroy the entire world by accident.

case.state: Hm... yeah, sounds to me like a risk worth avoidin'.

condition.saying: We gave them a loving home at the Princeton group where they can design weapons for my brothers, who are just as bitter and hateful as their former employer.

case.state: Hm... alright, guess that's pretty good. The blue-collared deserve a lot better than they usually get.

condition.saying: Especially if you worry whether or not they're cheating on you. Or them worrying about whether or not you're cheating on them.

case.state: If you're tryin' to frazz me out, kid, I'd advise you not. 'Less you wanna mess with... wait-

condition.saying: A-Are you sure this is the right group of p-people you want to be playing this game with?

case.state: {small}Well, this ain't my usual type of poker company, sure... but Matt suggested I get away from usual business for a while anyway, and this is about as far as it gets.{!reset}

condition.saying: U-um... y-you know... h-how... do you know how a girl like me could...

case.state: No need to be shy - I think we're all well past that point anyway.

condition.saying: That was... pretty lame of me. People think that because I'm sh-- cu-- petite, I'm childish and easy to dismiss...

case.state: Well, that ain't fair. I never met a man or woman in my life I felt good about judgin' from a glance.

condition.saying: S-so... i-if this isn't... Hmph. Why don't you teach me how to shoot? I can be a badass too.

case.state: Really...? Hm... gotta say, I like your eagerness. I'll let the boys on the Hyperion know we'll have a guest on the firin' range soon.

condition.saying: See, ~player~, Jim laughs at my jokes.

case.state: Damn... you gotta be pretty cold to not crack a smile at a joke like that, ~player~.

condition.saying: Well, then you can defnitely listen to Franchouchou in a fight, right? We've got great pump-up music!

case.state: Hm... well, I've listened to my country albums enough times to memorize nearly all of 'em; might be nice to mix it up a bit.

condition.saying: Well... I guess Franchouchou could move to other worlds... like... some kind of Nexus. What a great place to perform!

case.state: {small}Hm... I might happen to know just the type of place you're thinkin' of. You find all manner of worlds out there when you've traveled as much as I have.{!reset}
{small}Well, this joint seems to fill the description quite well, from what I've seen... 'course, certain other worlds I've been to come to mind too.{!reset}

condition.saying: He certainly runs the group like it's one of those...

case.state: Damn shame. I've seen all kinds of skill come from honest folk who don't need someone shoutin' in their ear all the time.

condition.saying: stage outfits

case.state: Yeah. It's a far cry from the worst you gotta do, but you still gotta do it. Best you can do is make it as comfy as it allows.

condition.saying: tragic death

case.state: Huh... I take it they were one of those "bitter rivalry" stories before?
Hm... I was gonna say it's complicated but... you're really makin' me second-guess here, can't lie.
Damn... you sure know how to read men like a book, don't you?
Then listen here good. Don't ever forget that they're your responsibility above all else. And don't put 'em into anything that you ain't sure about.
Well, usually my custom C-14 Gauss Rifle's enough to handle whatever's givin' me grief... though I keep around a prototype HEV railgun for the heavy-duty stuff.
...Guess that's one way of puttin' it, sure. And yeah - weird as it feels to admit it, I can't really see myself goin' back to bein' a farmboy again.
Yeah... that's the true mark of family right there; when they'll always stand by you, even when they need you to do better.

condition.saying: self-destructive idiot

case.state: I mean... really, the less selfish part of me was always fightin' for the lives and rights of others. After all that... I sure as shit don't know.
Well, a biker should always make sure his partner enjoys the ride... especially if they wanna finish it together.
Hey, I always make sure I know what my ride-along enjoys... and how well they can hold on.
Mortality...? Just what is it you're suggestin', Miko?
Bein' honest, I've served a whole slew of different nations and causes... though most recently, my boys and girls have been workin' for the Dominion.
Older? Wait... you wouldn't happen to be that ages-old fox spirit that folks 'round here have been talkin' of, would you?
Huh? Older as in... are my eyes playin' tricks on me again?
Harem? Me? Heh, well I'm flattered, Miko, but I ain't such a man. A few crime lords in Koprulu have 'em for sure, but that's not how I roll.

condition.saying: Tales of your exploits

case.state: Really? Well, looks like my reputation precedes me even here... who'd have thunk it?

condition.saying: monsterous army

case.state: Ah, so that's your angle for comin' here? Sounds like quite the contract - though the Raiders are actually kinda caught up in another war at the moment. In fact, your foes sound real damn similar to ours.

condition.saying: mindless husks

case.state: ...Yeah... Yeah, that's exactly it. Shit, have we been fightin' the same guy all along?

condition.saying: between all of us

case.state: Jeez, now there's a nightmare I didn't need tonight... there ain't no chance of this Grima findin' his way to this joint, is there?
Well... yeah, most likely.
...Yeah. You could definitely say that.
Always liked to think it was the latter.... though I'm a bit tempted to take you up on that offer, I'll admit.
It ain't just a planet - it's a whole collection of stars and systems; a sector. Earth folk call theirs the "Solar System", right?
Figured as much, 'specially with the side of the street you're walkin' on, Miko. It ain't no bother, anyhow.
Pretty much - my pilots are no slouches either, but it takes another level of trainin' to go toe-to-toe on the ground.
Heh, more or less. When it comes to warfare in Koprulu, only those at their peak have a chance of survivin' - even my pilots to a degree.
Well, now that you mention it... it has been a while since I last gobbled up a pretty little gal like you...
Well, you'd better watch out, then... I'm feelin' hungry, and I hear shrine maidens are quite good raw...
Well, yeah - I don't think I could hide that even if I tried. But I don't forget faces easily either, and I know I ain't seen yours, Syrenne.
I hail from the Koprulu Sector, though that probably doesn't mean much to you. It's a long way out from here.
Well, I only hope we'd turn out to be kindred spirits, from the sound of him... It's usually either that or bitter enemies with folks like that.
Well, color me honored, Yusuke - didn't think I'd find someone that interested in the man at the front of the Raiders tonight.
We weren't attacked, if that's what you're wonderin'. I signed onto the Confederacy Corps because they started offerin' bonuses, and my family needed the money, thanks to the taxes.
A couple did, yeah. We lived outside the law for a while, but not without trouble. One of them... well, he took the fall so I'd be able to live on a better man.
You said it. Anytime someone could contribute to the cause, I never had reason to turn 'em away. Anyone should be able to find a place in a ragtag group of misfits like us.
If I was the author of my own life? Guess I'd make it so I could go back home and find it just as it used to be, I'd start my own farm, and then just live the rest of my days away from war.
Never thought about it like that before. So it just comes down to expressin' what you think, even if it ain't what you'd expect?
Huh... Well, in all honesty, I oughta thank you too, Yusuke. Made me realize I oughta start thinkin' more about what to do with myself after the war's over.
Hm... Alright then, why not? You're quite the interestin' sort to talk with, Yusuke - and I could go for a good meal myself.
Growin' up as a farmboy probably had a lot to do with it. You can likely blame my family for it as well.
My dad was always quite the cowboy type himself, really. It comes natural when you live on a farm.
Ah, don't worry about that. I figured that wasn't the case.
It's all good. I didn't guess that was what you were talkin' about.
The name's Jim Raynor. Might be easier to flatter you in return if I knew your name too.
Well, I come from the Koprulu Sector. You probably have no idea what that is - it's way out on the far edges of the Milky Way.
You're too kind, Miss Setogaya. Just hope you ain't too attached to them, considerin' where this game might go...
Well, eventually, we figured out a way: engines known as Warp Drives that let us escape reality itself to reach a realm where everythin' travels faster.
Well, we learned that the best way of doin' it was by enterin' a dimension where everything moves much faster, usin' engines called Warp Drives.
Ain't that the truth. By this point, any place I can find where I don't gotta watch my ass sounds too good to be true.
I mean, you've probably got folks of all sorts in your army, don't you? What trouble's another big guy like me?
Guess there's just some things in military life that translate even across worlds, eh? I like to think all I've seen and done's given me quite the heap of knowledge on it.
That's where the internal hydraulics come into play - the interior's made of a sorta intelligent weave that detects size differences and adjusts the layerin' to fit with the user.
Our war against the Dominion was always a guerilla one, so stealin' supplies just came with it. Kept us fed while hurtin' them, so it was a win-win.
It wasn't. That's why we looked for volunteers in the groups that needed us the most - those who'd been ignored, thrown away, or hunted down by the Dominion.
That's also true. Which is why I'm grateful to have one hell of a science team - whenever there's an opportunity to nab some lab samples they could use, I make sure to take it.
If it has, then I wouldn't know. I don't try pokin' my nose into the personal lives of my boys and girls.
You've certainly got the gears in my mind turnin'... and I got the feelin' anyone'd be downright crazy to say no to someone as kind and pretty as you.
Hm... "teacher" was never a word that I figured fit me well... but that means a lot comin' from you, Miko.
Well, I stick by my C-14 rifle most of the time, but I break out a prototype HEV rifle for the heaviest stuff. Don't let the revolver fool you - it's far from my main gun.
I've seen enough to last any man ten lifetimes, Sheena. Including just about all you're thinkin' of... well, maybe not not magic hotsprings, though.
What, you think fightin' and dyin' in some pseudo-Valhalla is the norm for me? I ain't no stranger to cards, you know.
Well... I dunno. There's plenty of beauties there, for sure, but I think you'd stand out even among them, really.
You don't gotta bring that sort of thing up, Miss Ayano. I'm all too aware of the situation already.
If you wanna ask me why that is, well, I'm just as lost as you, Ayano.
Same thing with our Spectres, though we also mix up some Terrazine gas into their minds... it ain't as scary as it sounds, trust me.
Wasn't sure if I'd go with the gloves at first, but they do feel nice.
These were startin' to get a bit hot anyway - kinda glad to be rid of 'em now.
Give me a sec - they're more snug than I expected.
The coat doesn't even need the belt to stay on - it just wouldn't be the same without it.
It's funny - I think this is the first belt I've worn in a while that didn't have some some sort of equipment on it.
Guess if there's one occassion where I'd be cool bein' away from my revolver, it'd be the holiday season.
Huh, almost forgot for a sec that my holster ain't on this belt. Maybe I've had it for a bit too long...
Shame the coat's gotta go this early; it's nice to wear somethin' that soft for once.
Heh, you should've seen the look on the store cashier's face when he saw a famous outlaw walkin' in to buy this coat.
Would've loved this coat growin' up - winters on Shiloh could get pretty cold.
Well, it's the season to be generous, so... I'll give you a two-for-one deal this time.
The socks might be a bit much, I know, but I wanted to go all-out this season. Haven't gotten to do that often before.
Tell you what - I like you all, so I'll get rid of the socks too.
If you're thinkin' of any jokes about sittin' on my lap... well, might as well get 'em out of the way now.
Don't wanna take off the hat just yet - I'll sacrifice the pants next.
Hm... Nah, I like this hat. 'Sides, I think the pants are a more excitin' choice for now.
They were actually startin' to run out of these hats by the time I found it. Guess the holiday spirit's more alive than ever.
I've actually wondered if I could talk my Protoss friend Zeratul into tryin' one of these on. Say it's for "understanding Terran culture".
"'Tis the season to be jolly"... bet you'll all be real jolly about this part.
Mind mixin' my next Scotty Bolger's with eggnog? Never tried it before...
I'm hoping there's a good reason they didn't have you check your gun at the door.
Fine, just gimme a moment here.
Let's see... I guess I'll go with this now.
Bring me somethin' strong while I'm doing this, will ya?
Alright, these little guys are the first to go. Hope it'll be a while before they're joined by my other stuff.
Alright, now it really begins.
Fine by me. Don't need gloves to handle cards anyway.
Bein' frank, I'd be far more worried about losing these on the battlefield than just in some bar.
Guess I can lose this for a bit. This place is a far cry from the fringe world kinda bars anyhow.
If I couldn't stand to be away from my equipment, I'd probably have bigger problems than losing a card game anyway.
Never had to think tactically about clothing before... first time for everything, I guess.
Hm... guess I'll go with- no, wait...
Nobody swipe this while I'm not looking, capiche?
I've done a lot of weird shit in my day, and this is definitely one of the weirdest.
Lost plenty of times to my boys before... but it sure as hell never involved this.
Yeah, yeah, yuk it up.
Well, I've lost dignity in worse ways... not by much, though.
I guess on the bright side, this ain't the worst time I've been caught with my pants down. Figuratively and definitely literally.
I knew I should've stayed in bed this morning...
Yeah, Sarah would loooooove this, I'm sure.
Exactly; that ball and those moons are all in a system orbiting a star, and that system's just one of many that makes up a a sector in the galaxy... hope that makes sense.
Yeah, so picture this: that ball and moons, along with their sun, are all one system among many in a whole big sector, which is part of the galaxy. That sound right?
{small}From what I understand, it gives most of 'em a kinship as tight and true as any man could hope for... though they ain't above feudin' with each other, still.{!reset}
{small}There's no denyin' that they've got a special kinda bond from it... though I've seen enough evidence that they're just as prone to bickerin' as any of us.{!reset}
Well, that part ain't all bad. Guys like him are the most fun to toss out of a bar, after all.
Hey, at least he tryin't to hide it. It's courteous of him to basically tell everyone, "I'm always gonna sleep alone."
True that. 'Course, I like to make sure we can both get there 'round the same time.
Couldn't agree more, Jess... and rest assured, I ain't one to leave my partner behind, either.
Warp travel's come a long way since Terrans first arrived there, Nami. Travellin' from there to here still took longer than most trips, but it was managable.
Heh, sorry if I'm disappointin' ya. Us Koprulu-born Terrans can still trace our roots back to old Earth, you know.
Heh, wasn't expectin' that kind of surprise tonight, were you?
Heh, well, what can I say? I'm an interestin' kinda guy.
Heh, guess that confirms it. Don't worry, closest thing we have to that kinda mental image is our firebats.
Heh, don't worry, Ms. Hilda. Your secret's safe with me as long as mine is with you.
Well, alright then. You're gettin' me real curious to meet this friend of yours already.
Guess that makes sense. Where I'm from, I'm used to a "company" having men that number anywhere from sixty to two-hundred.
Heh, couldn't agree more, Noire. Just gotta go with your heart.
You said it, Noire. There ain't no beatin' what your heart tells you.
{small}Maybe it's just my own bad luck. Each one I've run into always comes with a shiny set of CMC plating and a nasty heap of brainwashin'.{!reset}
Heh, don't I wish. Running a minin' business would be a helluva lot less weight on my back than running a revolution.
Heh, maybe that's why Sarah always had an easier time clearin' them out. Well, besides the whole psionic stuff, anyway.
Mars? That's a planet somewhere in the old Earth system, right?
Change ain't easy, kid... but if you really want it, it's worth fightin' for.
If there's one thing I've learned about change, it's that it comes in a prickly package... but it's one I'd say is worth openin'.
Damn... I'm sure ol' Valerian would know a thing or two about that.
Yeah... I got a friend who knows exactly what you mean.
Don't sweat it too much, kiddo - just be there for 'em, and they'll be there for you... even when they're gone.
A day like that's still far, far away for you... but I know you'll do fine. You're a strong gal.
Terran history with them's not always the best... but if you can get on their good side, they're some of the tightest friends you'll ever meet.
Heh, it's quite the wide world out there, ain't it, kiddo?
I may harp on Koprulu a lot, kiddo... but bein' real, it's quite the wonderful place sometimes, too.
{small}That's the thing about bein' a guerilla force - you gotta fight and live outside society at the same time. When you strike, you gotta make sure the results mean somethin'.{!reset}
{small}It ain't easy, bein' at war and on the run at the same time. You gotta fight smarter than ever, and make sure each battle hits 'em where it hurts.{!reset}
Well, if we were gonna take down Mengsk, we'd have to show we're better than him - and that includes savin' those he wouldn't.
It ain't easy, sure... but whenever there was a chance we could keep less people from dyin', we were gonna take it.
Oh, trust me, they ain't any more spooky than the other Protoss. Still spooky, sure... but honorable as hell, too.
Believe me, kiddo, the Dark Templar are way more amicable than you'd think. I've trusted them with my life as often as they've trusted me with theirs.
It sounds nasty as hell, I know. But... well, I know better than most how far someone can be willin' to go for what they believe in.
Yeah, I can only imagine how it feels... All the same, I got a lotta respect for anyone willin' to go that far for their freedom.
Oh, right. Well, if you've seen love in your sector before... it probably ain't too different from how it happens in Koprulu.
Ah, I getcha. To be honest, though... it probably ain't that different from the love you've seen before.
O-Oh. Well... if you've seen how love works in your sector, then I think you've seen how love works, period.
Come on; you're young, you're sweet, and I think it's obvious you're smart too. Lotta folk out there don't have what you do.
Heh, don't worry, I kid. Kinda knew beforehand that I ain't the usual sort of crowd that comes here anyway.
Well, I definitely look forward to seein' that. But you've still got a lot of legwork to do there.
Suppose that's fair. Still, I'm guessin' you're too smart to expect someone like him to stick his neck out for you if worse comes to worst.
I gotcha. All the same... I don't think either of us expect he's the sort to care about anything but his bottom line in all that.
Pretty much, yeah. It's just a tool when you get right down to it, but you can't really deny the bond you've got after it's saved your life a few times.
More or less. You don't wanna become obsessed with it, for sure... but eventually, you reach a point where it's just as important to your ensemble as your shoes.
Uh... is there somethin' you gotta get off your chest, pal?
Golden rod? Incredible Hulk? Never heard of either of those models... Wait-
...I mean, if you wanna be real technical about it, then sure, it's like we're family already.
Anyway, if the place you come from is as high-tech as mine, it might be a nice change of pace if you toured around a more fantasy-oriented world. Ever heard of Azeroth?
...Wait, what was that last part-
No. And I think that'd be my answer right now even without the camera.
...Suppose it'd be a lost cause by this point to tell you to shut that damn thing off.
"Journalism", my ass...
Save it for someone who's your type, pal. I imagine it ain't hard to spot someone fine with you shovin' a camera everywhere.
...You want my honest opinion? You're a tabloid journalist who doesn't know when to quit; just another Donny Vermillion.
'Fraid I don't know much, but I will say this - start researchin' warp space. Just going faster ain't enough.
Well, if you're tryin' to go as fast as light, you're not shooting high enough. Look into warp space instead - don't know exactly how it works myself, though.
Hmph. Difference bein' that most animal hunters would try to avoid using tactics that could get some poor kid hurt.
Then get into it more often. Even the most decadent of my soldiers get chewed out if their hygene ain't up to snuff.
Heh, well how do you like that? The killer is gettin' slayed for once...
Hell if I know. Didn't take much time to study the nitty-gritty of details like that - that's what I have my science team for.
A couple, yeah. I may have formed the Raiders to take down a tyrant, but I didn't let it stop me from protectin' those in the way of other threats too.
Heh heh, ease up now, Ms. Suzukaze. I'm just messin' with you.
Eighteen, huh... now that I think about it, there's a lot more folks around that age here than I expected.
Yakuza? Oh yeah, that was a term for organized crime back on Old Earth, right? Well don't worry - I don't like 'em any more than you.
...Truth be told, I don't know. I'd thought I found mine before, but after what happened, I ain't so confident no more.
...Heh, well, if you still believe in me, boss, then I guess that's as good a reason as any to hold out hope.
Hah! Well, I don't know about that - my wife always seemed to have the edge over me with that, back in the day.
Right... sorry if I'm lettin' you down here.
Right, of course. Probably shouldn't think about the possibility of me losin' again, either.
So you have, have you? Guess we're two birds of a feather after all, Noire.
You don't say? Sure is nice to meet someone else here who knows what it's like, then.
Read my mind, Noire. Let's kick back together then, shall we?
Absolutely. Couldn't pick a better place to kick our feet up, Noire.
'Course, Noire - I wouldn't have made it this far if I wasn't careful.
Don't gotta remind me, Noire. I've had enough close calls to be real intimate with that fact.
That it does, Noire. Always good to have a chance to learn and improve.
Without a doubt. An expert with nothin' but a rock is far better off than some newbie with all the latest tech.

condition.saying: lose a lot of business

case.state: Right. Thanks, just... don't think we're at that point of chumminess yet.

condition.saying: take me for a ride

case.state: ...Well, that lost its subtly quickly.

condition.saying: the contents of your balls

case.state: Heh, well, guess that's the whole idea to begin with, ain't it?

Huh... never thought a place like that could even exist. Then again, never had much experience with places outside Koprulu, neither.
To be fair, it's only a marriage in the very technical sense. Bit of a long story... pretty funny one, though.
Well, you oughta have quite the interesting resume by then. Not many pirates I can think of who turned to modeling.

condition.saying: Wondering if there's a good way to stifle her own awkward tension and break the ice.

case.state: (Wonder if it was something I said earlier...)

condition.saying: I-I'm just a normal Japanese Idol! S-so... I-I guess I'm j-j-just really uncomfortable with guns.

case.state: Ah, I gotcha. Well, the dealer's put it out of sight now, so consider it out of mind too, Miss Sakura.

condition.saying: ...And handsome producers can still be huge jerks.

case.state: ...Oh, yeah. Another one of those "in it for the money" types, I take it?
Hmph. Then they ain't no leaders at all. Just a bunch of mob enforcers with prettier clothes and titles.
{small}Just as much their loss, then. Anyone can rule through fear, but makin' people follow you because they want to... it takes somethin' special.{!reset}
I think we've all got skeletons in our closets to some extent, Laevatein. But it's how we live with 'em that defines us.
The way I see it, Laevatein, we're all products of our pasts... but we don't need to be prisoners of 'em.
True that. In my experience, nothin' brings people together more than a common enemy to fight... or one giant asshole they want dead, in some cases.
Kinda funny to think about - when you got a new enemy that doesn't want to be reasoned with, suddenly breakin' bread with who you can doesn't seem so bad.
Don't you worry now, Hermione - I don't intend to give you or any other of the fine folks here any less tonight.
Heh, well, it ain't over 'till it's over, right? Let's see if you can turn this around yet, Hermione.
Yeah. I got no quarrel with you, understand, and it's clear you ain't the bad sort. But that kinda life is far behind me now, and I'd prefer to keep it that way.
I appreciate that. Still... some things require forces even greater than luck like yours to come around.
That eager to play matchmaker, huh? Never had a wingman quite like you before; this oughta be real interestin'.
Well, now you've just made it tempting... but alright, I won't.
Consider me flattered, doc. You certainly ain't disappointing so far either - and I expect that won't change as the game goes on.
Hey, you've got my curiosity so far, doc. And I think this game's just the thing to satisfy it.
Test criteria? What kinda test requires you to swing by a strip poker joint... and why couldn't it have been part of the Confederacy Corps trainin'?
Hm? You say somethin', Sucrose? Almost couldn't tell.
What was that, Sucrose? You went kinda quiet there...
Guess that's true... but you'll have to forgive me if I ain't leaping at the chance to have you direct my funeral, Miss Tao.
Right... well, you certainly know how to make a guy feel grateful he's still livin', Miss Tao.
Yeah... no. After the greetin' they gave us a few years ago, we're better off without 'em.
Imagine pillbugs that explode, horrible fusions of snakes and mantises, mammoths with tank-like carapace... Actually, maybe you're better off not knowin'.
Pretty much, actually. I may not quite understand their Khala as much as they do, but I respect their camaraderie and no-surrender attitude all the same.
Yeah... I only hope after this one, the Koprulu sector will have had its fill of war for a real long time.
Well, I wish you good luck as well, Monika. Any guy or gal would be real lucky to have you pick 'em.
Tryin' to get to the meat without all the fat, huh? I think I like you already, man.
Heh, I knew there was a reason I liked you. Not enough folks are interested in gettin' the straight story without all the pomp.
Tryin' to get to the meat without all the fat, huh? Well, considerin' how open you've been yourself so far, guess it's only fair I do the same.
Hell, you could describe most kinds of power like that. Good, bad - it's all determined by whoever's holdin' it.
Heh, I'm flattered. 'Least, I hope that's what my deeds will add up to, all in all.
Heh, sorry to say, but nope. Demolition's the only sport I've really played, boss.
Heh, thanks; I certainly try. Still, I've got a feelin' underestimating you would be a mistake - especially for yourself.
Hah! Don't I wish? You're right about workin' hard, though - I'm proud to say I've had a strong work ethic ever since I was just a farmboy.
Heh heh, that's true, boss. In a few months, you could be the terror of every lid you can imagine.
I think Koprulu ain't too bad 'long as you got someone to show you where to go and what to avoid. Though with the current war goin' on, I wouldn't recommend it now.
Well... thanks, Nagisa. I appreciate the sentiment.
Makes sense. A place like that oughta have all sorts of sights - plenty of beautiful ones, too.
Don't take me for bein' uncomfortable, boss - it's just taking some gettin' used to, is all.
Well, hopefully things will turn around now. Though they'll have to turn around quite a bit, really.
Yeah... still tryin' to realize you're serious about that.
Well... I guess if it's really what floats your boat.
Hm... You've got me there, I'll admit. And I gotta say, there's somethin' kinda... thrillin' about the thought of tryin' it with an android for once...
Alright, alright - you've been warmin' me up to the idea. I'll admit... my mind's been runnin' with the thought of holdin' your legs up to the air.
...Heh, guess there's still a place for good ol' romance in your heart after all. Maybe a place for it between your thighs, too...
Well, right back at ya, Lucina. I expect you won't make it easy... but then again, I didn't plan to either.
Well, right back at ya, Marth. I expect you won't make it easy... but then again, I didn't plan to either.
Yeah. That's what I thought.
Sure. Whatever you say.

condition.saying: built like a biker

case.state: True. But she was kind enough to invite me along, and I can't say no to a good game.
Heh, no offense to her or anything, but tryin' to imagine someone like that actin' tough is a real chuckle.
Huh... sounds like you got the luckiest metabolism draw out there.
Heh, you got one helluva good soul there, Miss Fina. Still, I won't ask you to leave and stop enjoyin' your hard-earned peace just to help a fellow you just met.
I certainly hope you're right, Fina... there's a whole lotta lives ridin' on this.
Well, that's real kind of you, Fina. And if you need help relaxin', consider the same offered to you as well.
The universe is larger than any of us will ever know, Jess' - there's plenty 'a places not even I've been to.
In a way, sure. It's been the only real home I've had the past several years... but for some R&R, this joint beats it by a mile.
Yep. Certainly more relaxin' than anything else I've done the past several years...
Just about anything you'd find on a farm - wheat, apples, berries, all that good stuff.
Just about anything you'd need a farm around for - wheat, tomatoes, peaches, you name it.
...Let's ust say I hope you and your folk never had to see anything as brutal as the Dominion, Miss Cynthia.
It was the nastiest regime you can imagine, Miss Cynthia... everyone had their own personal reasons for wanting it to burn.

condition.saying: Well. I'm Amy. And you know, all the girls like a man with a big... piece. That's the right word for gun, right?

case.state: Yeah... you okay? You sound kinda confused about this.

condition.saying: I think unloading might be the best part. What do you think?

case.state: Really? That's an odd part to fixate- wait a sec...

case.state: ...Christ, you're bein' serious, aren't you?

condition.saying: Two moms.

case.state: Ah. Gotcha.

condition.saying: ...Sorry, did that make things bad weird? Not good weird? I like good weird.

case.state: Well... I'm certainly not gonna forget this game anytime soon.

condition.saying: It's a big job. I am happy to stretch my limits to make sure it gets done right, Daddy.

case.state: Yeah... still not too sure about that term, Amy.
Yeah... but any power can start weighin' heavy after a while.
Maybe... but there's a certain fate for those who live by the sword for too long.
No man or woman should have that kinda power, kid... you least of all.
My mom and dad raised me to be humble, kid... at least I'm self-aware enough to know not even I should have that.
People's lives aren't mine to play god with, kid. And they ain't yours, neither.
Yeah... change comes whether you like it or not. Best you can do is hold onto what's still important.
Good point. Experience and age will change just about anyone - hopefully for the better.
Good. All the more reason to be glad bein' human, then.
If there's somethin' special you know that could turn anyone like you... then you can keep it to yourself, kid.
Geez... that smile definitely doesn't help, either.
Damn... do creepy smiles come naturally to you or somethin', kid?
Frankly, kid... I think I'd rather be Zerg-infested than whatever the hell you are.
I've known plenty of non-humans too, kid... and most of them are worth way more than you.
That kinda goal's gonna bring conflict no matter what, Laevatein. But you gotta good head on your shoulders. I believe in you.
You gotta good soul, Laevatein. Not everyone will take the peace you're tryin' to give 'em, but the ones who will deserve the chance.
Yeah... we've got a bigger challenge we're already dealin' with, but if we can handle it, I think we can handle just about anything.
The real test will be survivin' what comes after. If the new cabinet can handle it, then I can feel confident about trustin' them.

Yeah... ain't that a timeless question.
Hell, sometimes if they're bein' a pain, it's just because they like you. 'Long as they don't take it too far, of course.
Hey, if we gave up friendships just over the odd argument or whatever, makin' friends would be a lot harder.
Good to keep in mind. Havin' friends who know their way around that kinda place will do you better than any other prep work.
Nah. For the past several years, we've been fightin' for freedom... and more recently, our cause has become survival.
Hm... tell you what - throw in some vintage beer while you're at it, and I'll give it a good think-over.
Alright, how's this - if you can offer some ice-cold, vintage beer as well, I might think about it further.
Hey, now, I don't think you need to worry either way. Most of 'em don't have interest outside of Koprulu; in fact, some Protoss ain't even bad once you get to know them.
Settle down, Nami - they ain't the kinds to move far from Koprulu. 'Sides, some of the Protoss ain't even that bad once you know 'em.
Well, the arms race is half of any war. I may not be too familiar with how your artillery or magic works, but I'd recommend developin' it further along before these Grimeal do.
Quite the question you're askin' there, Lucy... 'course, that's assuming you'd be able to at all.
Quite the question you're askin' there, Marth... 'course, that's assuming you'd be able to at all.
Now there's a silver linin'. Course, I'm not gonna act like any war's somethin' you should be grateful for... but still.
From all I've heard about your sector so far, that'd be one hell of a nice change. Not that anyone should want an alien war to come for it to happen, of course.
Mm... Yeah, that's a terrifyin' thought for sure.
Yeah... let's hope things never come to that, then.
Hm... Guess we really oughta be grateful that the Zerg don't seem to have interest outside the Koprulu sector yet.
Real damn shame... Guess it's true what they say about someone in the world always wanting someone else dead, even in the worst of times.
Man... what is it about fightin' each other that our kind seems to love so much? 'Cause I've never seen the appeal.
...Well, guess we're both alike in our feelings on Earth. Wasn't sure at first if Koprulu was the only place with sour feelings on 'em.
Man, don't even get me started on Earth... real hive of villainy, it is.
...Wait, what---?
Wouldn't suprrise me. There's an odd kind of irony to them shippin' off their 'undesirables' after fighting so hard to bring them under their heel.
Maybe so. Guess they decided they weren't good enough even after fightin' tooth and nail to bring 'em under control.
Mm... Does make you wonder what's worse - being conquered to get killed and harvested, or forced to spend your whole life in servitude to your conquerers.
Yeah... that ain't a pretty fate. Though I know some who'd argue that any kinda death is preferable to livin' your life under the heel of warmongers like those.
Heh, then you've had better luck than we did, Meia. Against the UED, our only allies were enemies. Well, 'cept the Protoss, anyway...
Well, you're at least in a better position than we were, Meia. As soon as the UED went down, most of us went right back to feudin' with each other.
Well, it ain't just exclusive to men - it pays to be prepared regardless of who you are.
I mean, it's not like the women in my outfit neglected that either. Point is, you gotta be ready for anything in combat.
Hm... You're still pretty young, though. You got a lot more waitin' for you when it's all over.
Mm... Difference is, you've got plenty more ahead of you, Meia. I can tell you ain't seen and done too much yet.

condition.saying: Oh, really? Isn't smoking really bad for you...? I guess you could look super cool...

case.state: Well, I have been tryin' to kick it for a while, kid... but then again, there's a lot I've been tryin' to kick in my life.

condition.saying: So what if I am? We're professionals. I respect what you do, and how you look while you're doing it, and you do the same, and we'll keep this a fun performance, together!

{small}We snuck in some Ghosts that called in a few well-placed nukes, and the rest of the hive fell soon after. Don't think we lost a single civillian that day.{!reset}

condition.saying: Sadly, in my era it wasn't expected a woman would be able to handle the affairs of a nation. But with a little Taoist magic here and there, I appeared as man before my loyal subjects.

case.state: {small}Tch... people will believe whatever bull they wanna believe. I know I sure haven't seen much evidence suggestin' a man can always do a bang-up job ruling an empire.{!reset}

condition.saying: Heh. I aint had the chance to get old n grey fore I hadda retire from bikin. Glad to see of us is still ridin.

case.state: Life just got busier for ya, Saki? I know I kinda fell out of it for a while back when... actually, nevermind.
