It'd probably take some getting used to, of course. Bein' that far from home and all, not to mention workin' with a whole new crew...
Makes sense, yeah. I like to think my own parents had a similar effect on me... or tried to, anyway.
Trust me, you don't gotta worry about anythin' like that. Doubt it'd be really helpful to have on your resume anyhow.
Don't worry, you'll be far from there. I don't think it'd look very good for you if a nurse had to kill, anyway.
Well, it doesn't seem all that weird to me. You wanted to try somethin' new and strange, and you ended up here.
Hey, it's only strange if you make it strange. Ain't nothin' wrong with trying something outta your comfort zone for once.
Hmm... Then let me ask - you ever taken a little thing called a Turing Test before?
Really... So is there a surefire way you can prove it beyond a doubt, then?
Ah, my apologies. Suppose it goes to show - I'd never even really thought of how a fully-intelligent android would want me to act before.
Oh, sorry 'bout that. Guess I've got a lot to consider about this - hadn't thought that sentient androids would have their own different customs and whatnot.
{small}Heh, well, my mates from the Confederacy days sure had a likin' for gangs like yours - probably would've started one of their own if not for the Guild Wars.{!reset}
Wait, what in the-?!
Don't wanna pry too much, it's just- Jesus!
Strange, but... it looks just like the one Sarah wore, all those years ago...
The Vulture's a real beaut, trust me - ain't nothin' quite like the roar of the hover engines, ridin' off into the night.
Nah, he just ain't too keen on the Vulture specs. Ask me, he just can't appreciate the classics.
Makeup? You don't look like you got any-
Wait, what in the-?!
Well, you just know it's gotta have something interestin' behind it. 'Specially if someone ain't too keen on sayin' why.
You mean other than the skin and the- WOAH NELLY!
No, no, she ain't cast her mortal coil just yet. Problem is... I just don't know if I'll ever see her again.
{small}Well, no one talks with that kinda confidence unless they're all green behind the ears, or got a hefty amount of experience... and I ain't seein' any green on you.{!reset}
Heh, you sure like to talk the talk, kid... but can you walk the walk?
Dang... so they're like a whole subset of animals or critters out there? And those subsets have subsets of their own?
So if I got this right... "Pokemon" is a whole classification of critters? And there's even more categories beyond that?
{small}Bet it was a real sight to see, lil' hellraiser. Paint on mine's kinda worn off with the wear 'n tear... but I like to think that gives it more character.{!reset}
Alright... long as you don't start moanin' about livin' "for the swarm" and whatnot, I don't have no reason to doubt you.
Alright... seen plenty of infested with nothin' on 'em before...
{small}And a few of them... didn't really talk much either. For different reasons. But I didn't let that stop me from treatin' 'em how I would anyone else.{!reset}
...How in the hell do you know-
...I'm sorry, did you just mention the-
...What?! You know about the-
{small}Don't worry too much - I'm sure everyone here won't trouble you about it. Hell, I know I'd kill to play cards with my favorite country singers.{!reset}
{small}Hey, I'm sure any fans of yours here won't think less of you - I know I wouldn't think less of my favorite country singers if one of them were here.{!reset}
Yeah. She was contemplative and serious... and a bit sad, too. But when she smiled or laughed, it was like the whole room lit up.
{small}Bit of a relief to hear - biker wars where I come from usually involved at least a few knives - and guns, if things were real nasty.{!reset}
Really now? She usually this eccentric when cookin' up plans?
For real? It's good if she likes helpin' her friends, but is she always this fond of goin' right to the deep end?
So the shadier types figured out how to use 'em too? That's a scary thought...
Really... I think the idea of crooks like that usin' these creatures is even scarier.
WOAH, HOLY-!
Jesus, again?
Damn, here we go again---!
And there it goes!
Hot damn! She's goin' for the gold!
No one comes into the world just hatin' everything around them... not even the worst of us.
Even the worst people out there don't start off wanting to kill everything else. And I don't think you did, either.
Misanthropy ain't something you're born with, kid... even the worst folk I knew weren't like that.
Well now, sounds like quite the scene! Bet you must be proud to hail from a place like that.
Well, color me impressed! Your people sound like quite the good bunch, chief.
Settle down, lil' demon; I ain't lookin' to jest. Just not the kind of name I often see on other Terrans.
Hey, no need to get defensive, lil' demon. Just never heard another Terran with that kinda name.
Fakin' your death? Immortal sorcerer? Haven't heard a tale like this spun in quite some time...
Wait, he's actually a patron here?! Lookin' like that?
Huh... and your death? And subsequent un-death?
Hm, easy to forget that marriages were arranged once upon a time. So how'd you end up as a ghost, exactly?
{small}Well hell, I've understood you well enough so far. Ask me, there ain't no reason a wise establishment would turn you away once you've got your degree.{!reset}
{small}Hey, anyone willin' to put up with workin' to a degree is worth their salt. If we can understand you fine, then so can any job you wanna break into.{!reset}
WOAH! TAKE COVER!
Aw, hell! Hey, someone get a paramedic over here!
Huh... guess that'd explain all the odd and different folk around here. Not what I'd expect it to look like, though.
Really? Wouldn't have thought a hub world would be a poker joint... but I've seen enough here to suggest that.
Damn... you sound like you ain't kiddin'. How many of these places have you been to?
Jesus... for real? You ain't lost track of how many of them you've been to, have you?
Well, you're certainly nicer than the last one I met. That one tried to shoot me in the face.
Hey, considerin' you ain't shot at me yet, I can safely say you're the nicest one I've seen yet.
Right, yeah... it's kinda easy to forget that things weren't always peaches and cream back in the older days.
Good point... I ain't no study on older times and all, but I'm glad that we've come a long way since then.
Heheh. No, seriously, kid, what do you do?
C'mon, kid, I'm curious. Whaddya really do?
Don't worry now, it ain't no issue to me, Polly. Just takes some gettin' used to, is all.
Well now... that'd certainly be quite the change in fortune, wouldn't it?
Maybe his mistake was thinkin' it was going to happen soon, or in the wrong way. But it'll happen, one way or another.
Yeah... but they were only from one world, weren't they? There's a whole lotta worlds out there, kid, and more heroes than you or I can imagine.
Whoah! Alright, guess not everything's as easy as before...
So you've always been a goddess... and you spend your time playin' video games and eatin' pudding?
...And should I assume that you've been usin' your godly powers to just play video games and eat pudding for just as long?
Damn... must've been one hell of a propaganda campaign if it could get 'em to decide they hate each other like that.
Jeez... how bad was it if it was able to get men and women to think of each other like the devil?
Really? Well, don't see why not. What's on your mind, Nova?
Hm? Alright, talk to me. I'm all ears.
Sad but true; I've seen enough pirate fleets to know that all too well. Just don't forget that people deserve freedom to rule their own lives too.
I'd be lyin' if I said I didn't see evidence of that, unfortunately... but they're also smart enough that they deserve their own personal liberties as well.
Leave it, kid. I got nothin' else to say to you.
You ain't worth my time, kid. Just take it off and let's get this over with.
Okay, so... you have work. And what's that like?
So you have work, then? Like, some godly kinda work?
Sounds about right - I've seen all sorts of types come together thanks to a common foe. Turns out a group of assholes can be a great icebreaker.
Unitin' under a common enemy - now that's somethin' I'm real familiar with. And thankfully I've seen it be real effective, too.
That's definitely good. It won't take 'em overnight to unlearn everythin' that was fed to them, of course, but if they're willin' to try...
Startin' to happen already, then? That's all the better - especially considerin' that kinda change probably ain't quick.
Wait, you don't even do most of it? Wouldn't bein' some all-powerful deity make it a snap?
Is there even a good reason to shirk it onto others? I'd think bein' an immortal goddes gives you enough time for everythin' else already.
Well, consider it on, compadre! I'm interested to see what you pull... especially considerin' the usual crowd in this joint ain't exactly card regulars.
Heh, I certainly know a place or two like that... what're the folk of Bilgewater like, then? Friendly? Proud?
Pretty straightforward, really - serve the people, protect their wellbein', maintain peace as much as possible. Overall, to do better than his daddy did.
Hm? What's that there, Nami?
Huh? Whaddya got there?
Heh, you definitely sound like it. I'd almost expect you to have serious money ridin' on this game, if I didn't know better.
I mean, that's certainly a good point - I think most deities of old would've smited a mortal just for seein' them with their drawers dropped.
Hell, that's practically a point of proof. If you were like any of those old gods, we'd all be dead right now just for seein' you like this.
Well, I'll have to make sure I tune in sometime, then! 'Course, I suppose tryin' to see one of them live would be a whole challenge on its own...
Alright, then, guess I'll have to do some network diggin'! It'd probably be a lot easier than tryin' to catch one in-person, anyhow...
Wouldn't have guessed that. So what kinds of things have you been usin' it for, anyway? Beyond sightseein', obviously.
Interesting... So what's it been like, having it? Have you used it for anything other than explorin' different worlds?
HOOOOOLY HOT DAMN-!
Heh heh, well consider me amazed! Didn't think I'd live to see an AI companion as sophisticated as yours! Let alone talkative, too.
Woah, woah, slow down just a sec. So... you were science partners together, but then another AI went rogue and took control of the whole place?

I... What kinda Kafkaesque facility is this? They can make a more advanced AI than any folks in Koprulu have ever seen, but they can't even stop their test subjects from dyin' and everything breakin' down?
So she tests the--- Wait, back up, back up. You were in charge of... takin' care of all the humans? ...As in the ones who got killed?
...For whatever it's worth, hun', I am terribly sorry.
That's a relief. Bein' a ruler's undoubtedly a headache and a half, so most would've probably tried duckin' out at least 5 rounds ago.
I don't understand how gamblin' men do it, really. I feel like the pressure and stress alone could do 'em in, knowin' the risks.
Man, you sure know how to put a fellow at ease. If this were Koprulu, I'd start worryin' you were plottin' to kill me. Then again, Koprulu doesn't have friendly fox-spirits, sad as that is.
Come on, anyone with eyes here can see. You ain't letting your mind run wild with all the info ~player~ can put in you, are ya?
I mean... I guess. Like you said, probably not much need for-
...I'm guessin' that's not part of the routine?
...Does that happen often?
Magic, huh? Well, color me surprised - you don't normally hear tales of wizards and whatnot coming in the form of gamblers, bounty hunters, and other such scoundrels.
...Operational? Don't spend much time around... There a reason you're talkin' like some kinda robot?

Damn... Ghosts in Koprulu are trained to channel their psionics through their rifles, but maybe we should've been tryin' to make it work with cards this whole time instead. It'd be a hell of a lighter load.
Partner in crime? Now this I gotta hear about.
Heh, and how'd that come about? You ain't the type to play around with black magic or the like, are you?
Well, now I gotta ask how you did it. You don't strike me as the sort who'd tamper with occult necromancy or stuff like that.
Well, how's that goin' for you? Got a plot of land reserved for that, or just a smaller greenhouse?
Well... what about your family? They get you into gardenin' like mine did?
...It is what it is. All I can do is hope that this newer one will be the final war we've gotta deal with for a long time.
Photography, eh? Not bad - someone ought to capture the nicest parts of the world, right? Seen plenty in my travels that made me wish I had a photographer along with me.
Experience has taught me the value of keepin' my ear to the ground - especially when it comes to learnin' of other rebel movements.
Yeah, that's true. The larger the scale of who you're workin' with and the broader your efforts... it's still good work and all, but it's hard not to feel like somethin's lost with it.
So your revolution was also your inspiration for your art? That's pretty cool, man. I ain't no art expert, but I'm sure you made some pretty on-point stuff with that.
You don't say... It's good to hear of leaders like that who are the real deal, and ain't just lookin' out for themselves deep down.
Heh, imagine that. She must be quite the tough one if she was willin' to put on that kinda act for the whole scheme.
Well, you're definitely takin' your losses like a champ, that's for sure. Still, considerin' your penchant for nude paintings, you gotta admit the tables have turned in a way.
Is that why you're here, then? Lookin' for a break from it all for once?
I see... and you thought a strip poker joint was the best place to do that because...?
Really... so was there somethin' about playing strip poker here that made you figure you'd get the best set of options for that?
Hm... mind if I tagged along for that?
Well, I don't think anyone here's got a problem with it either way, boss. Variety's the spice of life, right?

condition.saying: Next hand! Next hand! Let's move on!

case.state: You know, her face kinda matches her hair when it's that red. I'm sure you agree, right, Kentucky?

condition.saying: (Heh... like a classic shoujo love triangle. I'd need them to like me back first though...)

case.state: ...But this the only time I've seen a literal saint turn someone into thinkin' sinfully.
That's certainly a relief... between you and me, that RPG's a safer sight in your hands than Miss rooty-tooty-aim-and-shooty there.
You were... dead? As in, dead dead?
Wait... ~player~ just brought you back from the dead? ~human.ifMale(He|She)~ can just do that?
...What? Are you sayin' that ~player~ can just bring folk back from the dead now?
Travellin' the galaxy while fightin' for your life... heh, been there enough times to last three lifetimes.
Seein' new sights and always having to watch your back... heh, sounds like Koprulu already.
Wait... are you meanin' to imply there's a Terran world with only men? Is that even possible?
Tarak... did you just say it's a world with only men? As in, no gals of any kind? For real?
...Right. Whatever.
Mm... sure.
Yeah, Graven's told me similar stuff about his contracts. "You can't pay the price, you don't get your vice."
{small}I ain't no stranger to the pricin' details, of course - someone puttin' their life on the line ain't gonna be cheap, 'specially when the law's got their own mark on 'em.{!reset}
Heh, wish I could say I don't get it, but... well, the backwaters of Koprulu ain't too peachy neither.
{small}Hate to say it, Revy, but I think I relate to that sentiment a bit too much... as far as hidin' in Koprulu's backwaters are concerned, anyway.{!reset}
Yeah, can't argue with that. Gettin' something free once in a while is quite the nice surprise.
Fair point. Not really possible to beat a price when it costs nothin', after all.
Huh... maybe we've been spendin' too much for our Ghosts' suits.
Hm... that's just about every benefit of the hi-tech suits we give our Ghosts, 'cept yours don't cost a fortune. Kinda embarassing.
Ask me, cigars are worth more bang for their buck anyway. Helluva lot harder to find, though.
Cigars are more worth the price anyway, even if it's higher. Good luck findin' a seller in Koprulu, though.
So if it wasn't on purpose, why'd you stick with each other? I'm guessin' there was a reason...
Well, you've been hangin' around each other since then, so... there a reason they kept you around?
Sure doesn't seem like a walk in the park... I take it you had some unfinished business that needed doin'?
{small}Creatin' something like that from scratch... most folk probably wouldn't go through all that trouble, unless they had somethin' real important to do.{!reset}
Sure don't envy those poor souls... sounds all too similar to the aftermaths of Zerg attacks.
That's about as rough as it can get... I've seen plenty of Zerg attacks, so unfortunately I think I can figure what it looks like.
"I think" ain't typically a statement said with confidence. I'm sure my med crew could spare a couple bloodbags if you needed it.
"That much"? Just what exactly were you tusslin' with before you got here?
Damn... your world ain't exactly an idyllic place, is it?
A world without sunlight for that long... don't wanna imagine what that's been like.
200? That's quite the number... you confirmed 'em all and everything?
200? Ain't callin' you a liar, but... you sure you ain't pullin' my leg?
Huh... that's a level of confidence I think most people only wish they had.
Damn... gotta say, Miss Jura, I'm pretty impressed with your conviction.
Hm... wouldn't have thought of it like that, Miss Jura.
Must be a pretty successful pirate group if you can afford all that. Pirates I'm used to tend to invest in... other things.
Well, can't criticize that. Better to splurge on fancy clothes than the drugs and other shady shit pirates typically like.
Touche - certainly makes you one-of-a-kind in the world of piracy.
Very good point - a leader's gotta know how to command respect regardless of what group they're in.
Certainly can't argue with that... then again, I don't think most guys would want to anyway.
Yeah, I've been to both 'a those, and I definitely prefer farm worlds. 'Course, I like the cities more than I do the infestations.
I mean, I prefer the farms either way... but I'd still have to rank cities higher than the infested areas.
You... really don't sound like you're jokin'... You're for real, aren't you?
...You... really ain't kiddin', are you?
So even after everythin', even after all you'd torn through... one guy almost stopped you.
So he came close, then... even with all your bluster about "power" and bein' above it all... it almost wasn't enough.
"Confused?" Yeah, sure. I don't think you felt bad about a single moment, kid.
Any other kinda person would've been confused, kid. Deep down or not, I think you liked it from the start.
Then you ain't no different from Amon, kid. I'm sure you know about him too, right?
Yeah... I'm sure Amon would say the same thing. I don't need to educate you on him, do I?
Huh... well, that explains a lot, actually.
Hm... well, I think you can ease up a little, Nami. This ain't a bounty joint, after all.
Heh, touch - funny how a strip poker game can bring out that growth... maybe not the way most would hope it would happen, but beggars can't be choosers, right?
Heh, guess you're right - who'd have guessed a night at a place like this would be the time it'd really sink in?
Guess it was their turn to learn to see you for who you really are as well... wonder how many others like 'em will go through that with other gals like you.
Sounds like they probably learned a fair deal from seein' you as well... I can only imagine how it'll be when others start followin' your examples too.
Well, I won't stop you, Nami... but I will ask that you let me watch it go down.
By all means, give it a go, Nami... just make sure I can get a good view of the whole thing.
Sure I do... but I don't think you're nearly as interested in that as all the 'hefty' sources they put in you... probably enough that you'd never need more again.
Well, it'd probably be a safe bet to just picture about any weapon you can think of... 'cept a bit bigger and nastier.
I know what you mean, Colt. It's a lost art in some ways... even if it ain't very practical.
Yeah, rifles just have the advantage of a larger caliber. And with the threats we face, we need nothin' less.
Well, it's like they say, right? "Jack of all trades, but master of none?" If you've only got one thing, might as well be the best at it.
Wait a minute... PSI? As in psionics?
I can definitely relate to that. Hope this game turns out to be just what you need, then.
Well, you'll be happy to know it wasn't long ago that we finally took 'em down. Had to get some unexpected help, but the rebellion I led was finally successful.
You're right about that, Kumatora. In fact, just recently we ended 'em for good - with the help of some unlikely allies, too.
...Yeah, that's a good point. I dunno, maybe someone 'round here could help you with that?
Well, to be specific, it'd be on the planet of Korhal, the heart of terran civilization. You oughta know that first.
I should also mention that "farther away" means a distant planet - Korhal, specifically. It ain't just another part of your world.
Well, I ain't typically one for crowds, but I'm not gonna turn away people lookin' to have a good time either. The more the merrier, right?
Well, best I can suggest is make sure you stay away from anything shady. I'd hate to imagine what this Dango Family's capable of if they really are crooked.
Well, considering the stuff they pulled and seemed to get away with whenever they had 'em... then again, maybe it's just because they were more distracting.
Heh, Demolition's the best sport ever, boss. Folks drive around in weaponized hot rods tryin' to blow each other up - and advanced safety measures means almost no one gets hurt.
Right. Don't worry, I'll shut my eyes for the time bein'.
Now that's the spirit. It ain't so hard once you've got your mind set, is it?
Still, I'd imagine you've got quite the degree of know-how already on it. Which is important for the next thing I wanted to ask...
Heh, well-put. Then I expect you to bring your A-game to this as well!
I mean, I just would've guessed someone high-rankin' would at least ask for a more flatterin' title.
Well, by the time soldiers go through enough ranks, they usually get tired of just bein' called a "grunt". 'Specially not with pride.
You don't gotta worry about that. I've already laid out a pretty big request to consider anyway.
It ain't no trouble, really. Wouldn't feel good askin' too much of you anyway.
They were... Heh, though it probably ain't best to think about 'em watching over me in a place like this.
That's the spirit. 'Sides, I'm willin' to bet everyone here felt out of place with this sorta thing at one point.
There you go. If it helps, I don't think you're the first one who felt a bit odd comin' here.
A requirement, huh? Damn, whoever built you really did think of everything...
So you passed it even before you were finished? Man, they definitely must've been thorough when they made you...
Good point. Guess I'll just try to go with the flow, Dorothy.
Suppose you're right. I'll try not to overthink it like you say, Dorothy.
Sounds like a damn fine philosophy to me - kinda startin' to wish your reign was in Koprulu instead.
'Course, they wouldn't have been as young as you... but hey, if you got the grit, you got the grit.
...Well... definitely wasn't expectin' this tonight.
Huh... guess I can take your word if you're still fine after losin' your head.
Damn straight - it ain't always the hardware you got, but the rider in it.
What in blazes-?!
Well... that just happened.
Yeah... special in more ways than I can even count.
'Fraid I couldn't figure it out. Never was good at decipherin' art.
Yeah, I sure get that. Reformin' the Dominion's left me pretty strapped for bikin' time lately, myself.
O-kay then... does that happen a lot?
You... wanted your soul to be used? How?
Givin' your soul to... "good use"? What are you talkin' about?
Hoo-wee... sounds like someone could spend their whole life studyin' these creatures and still not learn everythin' about them.
Hot damn... I've seen some varied creatures in my time, Miss Cynthia, but these really sound like somethin' else.
So if there's anything I or anyone else here can do to make you feel at home here, well, just say the word. Or write it, in your case.
...No one likes a bad comedian, Saki.
...Stick to the idol business, Saki. The comedy business ain't your thing.
{small}Very true - the horsepower under our hoods has saved us from all kinds of scraps. 'Course, the grenade launchers and mines weigh 'em down a bit...{!reset}
...Is this the usual kinda company you keep, ~player~?
...Goin' by your face, ~player~, I assume she ain't jokin'. And if I'm right... not sure what to think of you right now.
...Either she's got one bad sense of humor, ~player~, or... I don't know what to think of you anymore.
Sounds to me like the kinda system that'd collapse within a week. "Social issues" almost seems like an understatement.
Doesn't take a genius to figure there's problems. Bein' real, I'm surprised those planets are still standin'.
'Course, they'd all be hundreds of years old by now, so... they wouldn't exactly be alive.
Not that I could, anyway. Lotta them are from centuries ago, and last I checked, poker joints don't have many dead folk in 'em.
What, you expect me to not care about folks who didn't ask for war turnin' into casualties anyway? Like you, I take it?
Someone's gotta look out for the little guys... and it sure as hell won't be people like you.
If I didn't care about those people, I'd be no different from Mengsk... or you, for that matter.
We all gotta deal with our lot in life, Galatea - sometimes that means puttin' away the pain so you can smile a bit longer.
Okay... that's a part of the tradition I sure ain't seen before.
Well... at least my ears ain't ringin'.
Gotta say... I think I'm startin' to enjoy this, cowgirl.
Hoo-wee! Keep it up, cowgirl!
Woah! Cut it a little too close there...
Huh... you hang with ghosts often, Miko? 'Cause I don't remember hearin' this place was haunted or nothin'...
Certainly hope they don't succeed anytime soon... sounds like a helluva lot of power to end up in the wrong hands.
That's a relief. All the same, people like that tamin' those critters is a recipe for trouble.
Christ... it's gonna be a long night.
Great... as if ancient alien gods weren't bad enough, now I gotta deal with demons too.
For chrissake... why's the world seem bent on sendin' every malevolent jerk my way?
"Demon"... yeah, guess that would explain it. This'll be the most fitting "damn it" I've ever said...
Well hell, why not? After all I've seen, tonight's spirited company included, I'm ready to believe about anythin'.
Alright, I guess I can dig it. Not the first faked death for power I've seen, and certainly not the worst.
Damn... now that's what Sergeant Bronson would call a "premature detonation!"
Wait, wait... nevermind. Damn, Brock, you shrugged that off like a Zerg Roach!
Oof... guess that's why it ain't wise to trust other folk with your soul.
That's gotta sting... still, you don't hear of much good comin' from lettin' others handle your soul.
Better that way, if you ask me. Hell, I'd even say anyone who doesn't need deadly force to keep punks in line is the real deal.
Well now... I think you've put a spell on me already, Miss Meridies.
Damn... there's somethin' real enticin' about that harness there, but I can't figure out what...
Bit of a shame, the leopard print suits you well... but I'm still interested to see how you look outta the jungle, Jess'.
Well hey, might as well have fun with it, right? Plenty of worse ways for worlds to collide, after all.
Well, I ain't gonna complain. All things considered, a place like this is a pretty good spot to end up.
Wish I could, believe me. Newer circumstances have kinda made us... well, "work partners", I guess.
Oh, trust me, I agree. But... well, now we both got worse enemies, which means I still gotta put up with her.
It may not be tomorrow, Chara. It may not be with an army at their back. But mark my words - there's someone out there that's gonna stop you one day.
...Hm. I ain't that good, Galatea. But thanks.
Well, looks like it's been workin' out well for you so far. Must be quite the far cry from the time you're used to.
Certainly glad to see that things have been goin' better, Miko. Must be quite the different experience, livin' now.
Right... y'know, the polite thing to do would be to hand that back to her, ~player~.
I'd call that an obvious pile of horseshit, but... then again, I don't know what it'd be like to be subjected to that for years.
That's one of the craziest things I've ever heard. I'd call it unbelievable, but... they found a way to make y'all believe it anyway, right?
...Isn't that kind of a big leap? Playin' around one day, savin' the world the next?
Savin' the world's just another part of it for you? You sound pretty relaxed about it.
As for you, ~player~... if there's anything resemblin' decency left in you, this is the last night you'll hang with this psycho.
And if you want my advice on what to do with her, ~player~... after this game, you gotta run and don't look back.
Hm... if I had to wager, maybe this place has some kinda big mesh of whatever kinda energy makes worlds collide to begin with? Just a guess, though.
Well... the last "hub world" I was in had a huge amount of this kinda metaphysical energy to it. Maybe it's the same energy that this place has?
...Gotta be honest - I still have no idea what your godly life is like.
...I dunno if I'm just bein' dense or something, but I'm still confused as hell.
I'd certainly hope so - especially considerin' the criminal element you mentioned earlier.
Glad to hear it - though I'd imagine those crooks you brought up might be some unfortunate exceptions.
Couldn't have said it better myself. We've still got the threat of Amon to deal with, but afterwards... Koprulu might actually know legit peace for the first time ever.
Hm... not exactly a pleasant kinda town, I take it. Then again, a name like "Bilgewater" only suggests so much...
Mostly casual play - I ain't exactly had time to go huntin' around for serious games the last few years. Doesn't mean I go easy, of course.
Woah... I get you're hot stuff and all, Laevatein, but even the craziest Firebats wouldn't try pullin' that off!
Ain't nothin' wrong with that. 'Sides, considering my middle name wound up as "Eugene", I'm not in any place to judge.
I get that - totally respectable, there. And hey, if it helps you feel better, I'm stuck with "Eugene" as my middle name.
...Somethin' wrong? You looked like you were falterin' for a moment there.
...Is something goin' on? It sounded like you were almost thinkin' of something else there.
Well then... hope you don't mind if I'm grateful they didn't tag along tonight. Though, I'm guessin' they probably wouldn't anyway...
Hm... in that case, I'm happy you decided to show up tonight instead of them. Though then again, that probably wasn't likely anyway, right?
Guess that makes sense... though usually you think of stuff like super strength or flyin' when someone mentions superpowers. How's yours come into play?
Suppose that's obvious... though, how's it come into play? It ain't really the conventional kind of superpower people usually imagine.
Well, ain't you a true saint... though considerin' current things, I think you're far better at rulin' than you are at cards.
Good outlook there... hell, maybe I oughta ask you for leadership and card advice after this.
Heh, fair enough. Far be it from me to stay outta trouble that big - I just prefer not to leave it to luck.
O-kay... guess we just forgot about that first part, then...
Huh... well, you sure had us all fooled, didn't you, highness?
Really... guess my eyes ain't quite as keen as I thought.
...Hm. Well, it's nice to meet you for real, Lucina... though I wonder if any of our new pals here are disappointed by this little twist.
Heh, and I'm sure you've got us all quakin' in our shoes already, princess... or lack therof.
Well, don't worry, princess - I'm sure you've got at least one of us here scared for their life.
Really... so the cards themselves are magic too? I'm guessin' they don't sell them at just any regular hobby shop.

It typically takes a hefty price, alright - even if it ain't a monetary sort. That girl might've never even reached her 7th birthday before bein' whisked off by government spooks if she was born in Koprulu.
Shoot, really? Well, if you ask me, you and your lover bein' the only ones left after your crew's all gone is a pretty surefire sign it's meant to be.
All the same, it's a respectable thing to do, whether for trade or hobby. Talkin' with someone who does it never fails to bring me back to the good ol' days.
Sounds like you two were real close. I always figured I wanted to get back into farming when the war was over, if only...
...Shoot, I'm sorry. Didn't mean to take the wind outta your sails like that, man.
Hell, that's about the best kinda thing you can save. I'm sure those photos mean a lot to those in 'em as much as they do to you.
Look, I don't wanna sound heartless here, but... Are you sure it'll work? I mean, you don't end up in Hell for no reason, and it usually ain't a very virtuous reason.
Huh. Well, far be it from me to write off fallin' in love under strange circumstances...
Well, the fire and fury ain't meant to last forever, right? Hell, the movements that try forcin' them to do so usually don't end up so peachy.
I dunno, that doesn't sound like much of a fear to me. Gettin' away from everything, focusing on your craft... Sounds pretty nice.
Hah! Well, those probably still ended up more high-class than what my boys usually drew up on their armor and ships - typically just alien bones or scantily-clad ladies.
The way you talk about him, I kinda wish I could get the chance to meet him myself. Probably not likely, though, right?
